node_data.text: ... how much do you think it's worth? Old Ethel said she'd offer me gold for it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She closes the box and plays her fingers along the lid. Abruptly, she offers it up.NodeContext: Hesitant and suddenly serious, intent on  your response

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Sell it? I don't think your 'little monster' would like that.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: No, she would not. Near screamed our ears off when my husband tried to leave it in Elturel.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Rueful, remembering her daughter's tantrum

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: We tried to travel light, but... when the gnolls found us, we couldn't... they couldn't run-
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Breaking down into tears as she tries to tell the storyNodeContext: Deep regret, breaking up towards end of sentence

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: I don't... what else can I do? They say you need coin to enter the city. For bribes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Composing herself, trying to be pragmatic

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: This isn't my problem.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: ... you're right. I'm sure you don't want to listen to my prattling. Sorry.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hurt but hiding it - she's just told you something heartbreaking and you've dismissed her trauma.

session_synopses: Nerela is wondering whether to sell a music box, the only memento she has of the husband and daughter who were killed by gnolls on the road here. It's a scam - her story is fabricated and the box is a dime a dozen. Player can comfort her or see through her story. Her overall demeanour is weary, fragile (unless you uncover her scam)

AD_Guards.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards.text: Don't do this to me, Kanon.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Wotcher messin' with my cage for?
Caged.context: NodeContext: spoken when player tampers with her cage while she's locked up - curious

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Didn't expect to see a drow in here. Did the boss lady send you to rescue me?

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: You're not mates with the tiefs, are you? You need to get back to your own people before you go soft.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: The lady that sent me here's the cruellest drow I ever met. You could learn a thing or two from her.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Get me outta here, and I'll take you to meet her and the rest of my tribe.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: No point turnin' on yer own if yer just gonna give 'em a little tap.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Mocking - just watched you attack allies to save her but let them live

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: It's too late to make friends, worgmeat. My tribe's comin'.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking satisfaction

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: They're gonna burn this pretty place for the glory of the Absolute and 'ang ya by yer guts.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking satisfaction

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Don't worry, I'll be gone before the killing starts.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Oh, we like it when people run - makes 'em taste sweeter when ya catch 'em.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Cunning.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Unless... unless ya listen to me. I can save ya.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Slyly

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Help me escape, an' I'll tell my mates to leave ya alone.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Wot do ya say? We 'ave a deal?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It's a deal, signed and struck.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Then hurry up an' do it. My tribe ain't as friendly as I am.

AD_TieflingLeader.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader.text: Why don't you just set me free, tiefy?

AD_TieflingLeader.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader.text: I'll tell you everything you want to know... I swear.
AD_TieflingLeader.context: NodeContext: she's messing with him. she won't tell him shit and they both know it. she's wheedling him.

AD_TieflingLeader.speaker: Sazza
AD_TieflingLeader.text: And you ain't a good player.

PAD_Freed.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed.text: That goblin is in my debt - should prove useful one day.

PAD_Freed.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed.text: Or it'll come back to haunt us.
PAD_Freed.context: NodeContext: Karlach: A little naive but sincere.

session_synopses.AD_Guards: Several conditions of conversations between Arka and Memnos here: Sazza escaped, sazza was killed, the pair wait for the goblin attack at the gates, or Arka's brother, Kanon, has been killed by goblins.
session_synopses.Caged: Character is caged for this entire dialogue If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp.
session_synopses:
If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp. Note from Swen on this dialogue: ''I also want a different emotion in there. This goblin is negotiating with me. Think a terrorist that is locked up and who is offering their interrogators an option to save their lives if they free her.
It'll be quite the intense conversation.''
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeader: Conversation between Zevlor and Sazza that the player can overhear. The idea is that the player will understand there's something weird going on with Zevlor, that he isn't all he seems, without giving away the whole shebang.
session_synopses.Transit: The grieving tiefling pair moves to Sazza. Arka is set on killing Sazza as indirect revenge for the death of Kanon, who was slain by goblins.
session_synopses.PAD_Freed: This VB plays after Sazza was escorted outside of the Grove.The dialog may play with one or two speakers.Speaker 1 is the character who helped her escape.Speaker 2 is an accompanying party member, and as such may have an opinion on the issue.

RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses.text: You better not linger for too long. Those goblins just aren't normal.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Ah, the fighting foulblood. Glad to know one of you has a spine.
RaidAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: She cleans her wound, a cut on her arm with a [cleaning cloth]

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer.text: I already regret saving your life.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Ah - bruised your feelings, did I? Excuse me if I don't weep - got problems of my own.
RaidAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: My arm's near hanging off after wise Zevlor left us to die at the gate.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: And then he has the bloody gall to try and blame it all on us.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer.text: He let you in, didn't he? It could have been worse.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: You're trying to be gracious and she's not having any of it.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: We expected a soft job. Something to test the new lad, maybe, but not a bloody goblin nest.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: She's justifying her actions - they'd taken on a job that seemed simple but quickly got out of hand. People died and she's doggedly maintaining that she's the victim. More explanatory than whiny, though.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Most would've turned tail at the sight. But not Liam, no - he charged them, the stupid bastard.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: She's genuinely hurt at the loss of this recruit but projecting a knowing persona to hide it, as if his bravery is somehow a rookie mistake. Note of incredulity rather than laughing at him, as if he did something very stupid.

VB_AtCorpses.speaker: Player
VB_AtCorpses.text: I wonder where they were going.

LeaderAtCorpses.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses.text: Thought you was busy with the foulbloods in Halsin's grove.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: You shouldn't have brought Liam along. Lad was too young.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: Everyone needs to cut their teeth sometime.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: Cut his teeth?! For his sake, I hope he's dead already.

session_synopses.RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses: The adventurer is standing next to the corpses of her comrades he left behind while running for the goblins.
session_synopses.RaidAdventurer:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.VB_AtCorpses: Remarking on corpses on the road.
session_synopses.LeaderAtCorpses: Aradin comes across the corpses of some of his friends, who were lost during the goblin raid. He's in a neutral location at a bridge and observing the corpses of his people and of goblins, who were also killed in the fight.
session_synopses.AD_LeavingCorpses: After encountering some dead adventurers in the forest, Aradin urges his remaining company to keep moving (only plays if he's not alone).
session_synopses.AD_AradinAndRemira: Aradin and Remira are having a drink after arriving back in the Druid Grove.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Barth
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Don't make me hurt you, boy.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Too late. Looking at you is painful enough.

Trainee1.speaker: Umi
Trainee1.text: Oh! Uh... right. 'Go for the heart.'
Trainee1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.NodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.

AD_HideoutTrespass.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutTrespass.text: Fine. I'll just go tell the guards you kicked us out of our home.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I don't have money or anything to sell. My p-partner does that.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_002.text: So what's your side of the business?

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I'm the guard? So... don't steal anything! I'm watching you!

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Little slow on the uptake, aren't you?

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Not sure why you're poking your nose in our business, though.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001.text: I don't even know what your business is.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: This is our hideout, but hey, maybe you didn't know.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Because of that, I'll give you a ten-count to leave.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Sorry about the nest. You guys find anything good today?

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Nah. Everyone's got junk. Worse than junk.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Don't worry, kid. In Baldur's Gate, purses practically grow on trees.

AD_MerchantLeaves.speaker: Mattis
AD_MerchantLeaves.context: NodeContext: Prompting, building confidence in his little sister.

VB_FoundStolenGoods.speaker: Player
VB_FoundStolenGoods.context: NodeContext: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place

HideoutGuard_002.speaker: Zaki
HideoutGuard_002.text: You don't look so tough. Mol fought off a hobgoblin all by herself.
HideoutGuard_002.context: NodeContext: Tough guy act from a kid. Potentially referring to Lae'zel (toad-lady)

CaughtThief.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief.text: *You suddenly feel something moving against your back and turn.*
CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying

CaughtThief.speaker: Player
CaughtThief.text: Ignore her theatrics and grab her.

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Child being shaken by player. She struggles free, and a few trinkets fall to the groundNodeContext: Scared and in pain

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Escapes the player's grasp, runs away.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Uh, hey. You here to trade or...

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Yeah, I know. I was standing right here, telling her to rob you.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001.text: You could at least pretend to be sorry.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: I am sorry! Sorry we're still talking about this.
Pickpocket_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sincere, then mocking. NodeContext: Insistent, then mocking.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Look, you caught her. Good for you, you aren't a chump like everybody else around here.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Now, do me a favour. Make room for the chumps.

AD_CannotFitCrack.speaker: Player
AD_CannotFitCrack.text: I can't fit through here. Wonder if there's another way in.

Trainee3.speaker: Gan
Trainee3.text: This is boring. We should train against real goblins!

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: I saw you at the gates. You fight well.
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: All the trainees are getting added to the dialog on this nodeNodeContext: Teacher voice.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A few words for the kids? Spare a story or two?
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: The global flag checks if any kid failed to be includedNodeContext: lower, not for the ears of the children

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: They're just children - why are you teaching them to fight?

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: It's that or teach them to beg for their lives.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: The goblins will chase us to Baldur's Gate and these kids know it.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A warrior like you could lift their spirits.

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: I'll lift their spirits by wiping out that whole camp of goblins by myself.
Trainer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken to trainer (overheard by kids)

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: Thanks. I prefer when they smile.

Trainee2.speaker: Ide
Trainee2.text: Next time the goblins come, I'll be ready.

Trainee2.speaker: Wyll
Trainee2.text: Don't push it, kid. If you see trouble, then run. Only fight if you have to.

AD_Trespassing.speaker: Mattis, Meli, Mirkon, Silfy, Zaki
AD_Trespassing.text: You can't be here! This is our hideout!

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: Do we get to wear armour too?

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: No. We have nothing that would fit you.
AD_Trainee2Responses.context: NodeContext: Sad. Child has no protection.

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses.context: NodeContext: Doesn't understand that she's in danger.

AD_Trainee1Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee1Responses.text: Throat if you can. Wrist if you can't.

AD_PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
AD_PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: Spoken to himself; checking his 'wares'

AD_GuardAfterKnockout.speaker: Ikaron
AD_GuardAfterKnockout.context: NodeContext: aradin has been knocked out; ikaron is happy

session_synopses.AD_AdventurervsKid: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.
session_synopses.Trainee1: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutTrespass: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_002: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.
session_synopses.HideoutKid_001: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutGuards: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MerchantLeaves: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.
session_synopses.VB_FoundStolenGoods: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place
session_synopses.HideoutGuard_002: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.
session_synopses.CaughtThief: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_001: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)
session_synopses.AD_CannotFitCrack: Player found a crack through which they potentially can or cannot enter the kids' hideout.
session_synopses.Trainee3: Tiefling child far too confident they can fight goblins next time, even when scared.
session_synopses.AD_RobberKid: Child pickpocket, bored out of his mind, talking out loud.
session_synopses.Trainer: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.
session_synopses.Trainee2: Tiefling child confident they can fight goblins next time they come.
session_synopses.AD_Trespassing: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee2Responses: Training in combat with an adult tiefling. Ide is 9-10. Nervous, but trying to be brave
session_synopses.AD_MagicTrick: Silfy tries to learn Mattis's sleight of hand tricks. Big brother indulging his younger sister.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee1Responses: Training in self-defence with an adult. Umi is 8-9 years old and timid.
session_synopses.AD_TrainerLessons: A trainer speaking to children being taught to defend themselves in a makeshift outdoor training arena.
session_synopses.AD_PickpocketTrader: Scammer kid mutters to himself after having swindled someone.
session_synopses.AD_GuardAfterKnockout: After the confrontation at teh gates where Zevlor and Aradin show down. Ikaron, a tiefling, is pro Zevlor.

PAD_TunnelTurret.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelTurret.text: Glowing eyes are rarely a good sign. Best be careful.

session_synopses.PAD_TunnelTurret: Played when discovering one of the druid turret totems.

MeetAtDruidsGrove.speaker: Phasm
MeetAtDruidsGrove.text: Ah, you're addressing me. A humble ox. How... quaint.

MeetAtDruidsGrove.speaker: Player
MeetAtDruidsGrove.text: There's something strange about this ox. What is it?

MeetAtDruidsGrove.speaker: Narrator
MeetAtDruidsGrove.text: *Something's off. This creature isn't what it appears to be.*

MeetAtDruidsGrove.speaker: Player
MeetAtDruidsGrove.text: There's more to you than meets the eye. Care to explain?

MeetAtDruidsGrove.speaker: Player
MeetAtDruidsGrove.text: Fine. I heard the tieflings are going to butcher one of you for food, so your secret will die with you.

MeetAtDruidsGrove.speaker: Phasm
MeetAtDruidsGrove.text: A pitiful lie. Scurry along now, before something dreadful happens to you.

session_synopses.MeetAtDruidsGrove: The player comes across some ox in the Tieflings cave at Druid's Grove. The player may notice the ox acting strangely.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Wyvern poison. Let's hope it doesn't come to that.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better a quick draught than ceremorphosis, nonetheless.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better to have on hand than not.

AD_Busy.speaker: Nettie
AD_Busy.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hand raised in a sign to wait and then turns back to what she was doing .NodeContext: Terse, impatient. She's dealing with serious matters right now.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: First you save us from goblins, then Kagha's treachery. You're making your mark.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.NodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Give me a moment. I'll be right with you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the playerNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Excuse me? I'm more important than some bird.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: God or fieldmouse, no one's more important than the patient in front of you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still working on the birdNodeContext: Working on bird, doesn't look up at player

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Vis medicatrix...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Casts spell (healing word) on the bird.NodeContext: A quietly murmured spell

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: There. It's up to her now. Life or death.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still looking at the birdNodeContext: Still looking at the bird

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what -
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Friendly, but cuts herself off when she sees you're a race she doesn't like

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Drow. Last time I saw one of you folk, he tried to slit me open. I hope you're more agreeable.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Doesn't like drow, but she's willing to give you a chance.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm looking for Nettie.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: You found her. But I still don't know what she can do for you.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Do you know anything about mind flayers?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: ...Why are you asking?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Cautious. You've just asked what she knows about very dangerous creatures.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Humour my curiosity.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: I know they're nasty creatures. Can get in your head and convince you up is down.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Suspects you're not telling her everything

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: And that's not all they'll do inside your head.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Tell me honestly: are you infected? Is that why you're asking?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: No, of course not. I ask everyone that question.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: All right. Well, come back if you need anything.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Not fully convinced

AD.speaker: Nettie
AD.text: Halsin would have known what to do. Damn it all.

Bird.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird.text: To find Halsin. There's not a moment to lose!

AD_TadpoledStart.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledStart.text: We need to be quick. This way.
AD_TadpoledStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing for the player to follower her as she escorts them to the storage room, where they will be quarantined. NodeContext: Concerned

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I wonder what happened to that drow.

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: Is there a dead tadpole in that jar?

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I can't tell if this is a temple or a library.

AD_TadpoledCombat.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledCombat.text: I don't want to hurt you - but I have to protect the others.

AD_WithBird.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird.text: They did a number on you, didn't they?
AD_WithBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunched over the bird, moving hands over it.NodeContext: Sadly

AD_WithBird.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunched over the bird, moving hands over it.NodeContext: Gently, as if to a child

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Something took a chunk out of you. What happened?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird says nothing, trying to rest.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Something took a chunk out of you. What happened?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird says nothing, trying to rest.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Something took a chunk out of you. What happened?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird says nothing, trying to rest.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player prods the bird's injured wing

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.text: Big dog - gnoll... I got too close...

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Where did you see these gnolls?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird lapses into silence, her head lolling to the side.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *She lies limply on the table, completely still.*
WoundedBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player prods the bird. No response.

PAD_FeelingSick.speaker: Player
PAD_FeelingSick.text: I don't feel too good. What did that druid scratch me with?
PAD_FeelingSick.context: NodeContext: Poison is slowly taking effect. You don't feel great, but it's nothing serious yet.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: Looks like Halsin's our best bet for a cure.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: We need to find him, before it's too late.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: What if something happened to him?

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: All the more reason to hurry.

session_synopses.PAD_Cyanide: Context: Nettie has given the player a vial of poison to take if they start turning into mind flayers. Players reflect on whether they should actually take it if the time comes.Speaker 1 has just promised Nettie they will take the poison if they begin to turn. (SPEAK TO JORDI, The Speaker 1 nodes may need to be changed. )Speaker 2 reacts to Speaker 1 acquiring the poison after swearing to Nettie they'll use it if they start to turn.Gale - Shadowheart: We'll resort to poison if necessary.Lae'zel - Astarion - Wyll - Karlach: It won't come to that - don't entertain the option.
session_synopses.AD_Busy: Nettie is dealing with a player and has been interrupted by another player.
session_synopses: Nettie is the apprentice of Halsin, the missing druid. We can tell her about the parasite in our heads. She listens with compassion but decides the player is too dangerous and must be quarantined. If she knows about the parasite, she'll invite the player to come with her deeper into her rooms for "treatement."
session_synopses.AD: This triggers as Nettie is at her desk in Halsin's lab, researching and organising. The bird she was treating may have died at this point.
session_synopses.Bird: This bird has been told to go and find Halsin and you're interupting him just as he's getting ready to take flight. He's tense and in a hurry to be gone, so he'll only answer one question before taking to the skies and carrying out his mission.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledStart: Nettie's comments as she walks with the 'infected' player to the storage room, where they will be quarantined.
session_synopses.PAD_SeeDrow: The player broke inside the room without Nettie. Normally they follow her inside and they get the info from her. The VB stops playing when the tadpoled scene with Nettie starts or when Halsin is found in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledCombat: The player triggered combat during the tadpoled scene
session_synopses.AD_WithBird: Nettie is tending to a badly wounded bird. The bird is weak, its life hangs in the balance, but Nettie is doing what she can.
session_synopses.WoundedBird: Wounded bird is resting on the table after being treated by Nettie. It's probably going to die. If you poke it repeatedly, it will die.
session_synopses.PAD_FeelingSick: |The player has the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN on them. This status has 3 stages leading to death. The player is slowly dying.The first stage is right after being stung by Nettie in the situation Halsin's Apprentice (the reaction of the player is covered in the dialog DEN_Apprentice_Cyanide).This PAD plays after a long rest: the player rested but the status is worsening. The status is getting to stage 2 and then to stage 3, each time having worse gameplay effects.After stage 3, the status kills the player; the PAD DEN_Apprentice_PAD_Dying plays in that case.|
session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleResearch: Player read Halsin's research on the mind flayer tadpole. The VB plays only if they didn't find Halsin already and didn't go through the tadpoled scene with Nettie (otherwise they got all that information from her so it's not a surprise).

Captain_AD_TakingTurn_Combat.speaker: Za'krug
Captain_AD_TakingTurn_Combat.text: I'll bleed every last one of you!

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Why didn't we stop her? We should've stopped her!
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself for your daughter's death

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.text: We didn't do this, do you hear me? It was Kagha.
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: You know where you husband's mind is going and you won't have it - firm, voice like still. Hint of violence.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Cursed druids. I hate them all.

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: Few outsiders are allowed in here - be respectful and do not interfere.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

Guard2.speaker: Maggran
Guard2.context: NodeContext: SFX only - animal sound. Do not record.

AD_Protesters.speaker: Rechel
AD_Protesters.text: Do all the damn rituals you want - we're not leaving 'til it's safe!
AD_Protesters.context: NodeContext: Angry, Shouting at some druids who're trying to force them out of the grove and into danger.

AD_Protesters.speaker: Amek
AD_Protesters.context: NodeContext: Angry, Shouting at some druids who're trying to force them out of the grove and into danger.

node_data.speaker: Maggran
node_data.text: *Roar!*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Threatening roar + aggressive stance from the bear/druid. But he doesn't attack.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: Calm, Maggran. Give them a chance.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druid guard raises a hand to her bear colleague, stilling him.NodeContext: She's addressing the bear, but 'give him/her a chance' is more for the player's benefit.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: You - get back.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jeorna (druid1) turns to address the player.NodeContext: Entry not up for discussion.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Why? What's so special down here?

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: It's forbidden to outsiders - Kagha's orders.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bear-druid glowers menacingly when druid says 'see what happens'

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Let my daughter go - right now.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the guards face - have the feeling of a showdownNodeContext: AbSolutely furious and ready to fight ever single druid with your bare hands if you have to. These people took your daughter  - and you're going to get her back.

ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
ParentsScene.text: She's a thief, hellspawn. And you will wait for Kagha's judgement. Now get back.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over her - roaring in her faceNodeContext: Snapping back at the woman. The child is a thief and a liar as far as you're concerned. Right in her face as you snap at her to get back,

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Argh. Let me through, mragreshem, or I'll rip your damned throat out!
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Move as if to push past the guardsNodeContext: You've lost your temper, you're pushing past - utterly furious

ParentsScene.speaker: Maggran
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transform into a bear. Stamping the ground and roaring - the tieflings jumpe back wards.NodeContext: Roar in rage as you transform into a bear

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: All Arabella wanted to do is help. But you and half the grove stood by and let her die - alone.

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: Get out of my sight. For your own good.

Guard1.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1.text: Your companion vouched for you, but you're being watched. Respect our grove.
Guard1.context: NodeContext: Terse. The player's been granted entry but the guard isn't too welcoming.

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.Guard2: Maggran (druid guarding the entrance to the inner sanctum of the Emerald Grove) is in bear form. He delivers curt, bestial one-liners if the player has speak with animals. He doesn't want them around. He has a lone human fallback line should he somehow transform.
session_synopses.AD_Protesters: Three tieflings voice their anger at how they're being treated by the druids of the grove. They've been barred from entry into an innermost section while the fdruids conduct a ritual that will ultimately seal off the grove.
session_synopses: Three druids guard the entrance to the inner part of their sanctuary, blocking any outsiders. They're on edge, having recently driven back some outraged tiefling refugees who know the druids hold one of their children captive. One of the druids transformed into a bear during this confrontation, causing the tieflings to back down. Now we try to gain passage while tempers are still running hot.
session_synopses.ParentsScene: Marricko and Locke are trying to force their way past multiple guards to get into the inner grove. Their daughter was taken by the druids and stands accused of thievery. This is a tense scene - the threat of violence close to the surface. Their daughter is NOT present - she is in the inner chambers of the druid grove.
session_synopses.SoloParentA: This is for the edgecase in which one of the parents has died. In this case - Locke, the husband survives. In the first scenarion he rewards and thanks the player for saving his daughter's life - lamenting briefly on their lives without Arabella's mother.In the second, he learns that Arabella has died. He is overcome with grief and rage at losing both his wife and daughter.
session_synopses.Guard1: Jeorna, one of the druid grove guards, speaks to the player after they've been allowed entry. She's curt and not greatly pleased that we're allowed inside.

RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Kanon
RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.text: VO_SFX: Death cry - While turning the wheel to open the gate, Kanon gets hit by an arrow in the neck and dies

RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.speaker: Remira
RaidingParty_PleaAtTheGate.text: VO_SFX description: Heavy lifting efforts to try to keep gate open (along with Aradin & Barth). It's too heavy so the gate slams shut

CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.speaker: GROUP_Civilians, GROUP_Dwarves, GROUP_Elves, GROUP_Gith, GROUP_Guards, GROUP_Humans, GROUP_Tiefling
CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.text: The goblin is escaping! Kill it!

session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime: Assorted residents of the Druid Grove react to a goblin prisoner having broken free.

session_synopses.DEN_PleaAtTheGate_Adventurers: World behaviours for Aradin and the group, they are banging at the gate

Transition.speaker: Gerson the Bent
Transition.text: Have you heard? Scouts have just reported the goblins have been neutralised. The way is clear!

Transition.speaker: Gerson the Bent
Transition.text: The others are gathering near the gate - come on!

session_synopses.Transition: This scene plays for people in the Druid Grove if another player kills the Goblin Leaders away from the Grove.

PAD_DiscoverTrap.speaker: Player
PAD_DiscoverTrap.text: I don't like the look of that mushroom. I should stay clear.

session_synopses.PAD_DiscoverTrap: The player has discovered a hostile looking mushroom in the DEN Grove Prison. It's origins are from the Underdark, but have been planted by an inquisitive druid.

FrescoFoundingGrove.speaker: Narrator
FrescoFoundingGrove.text:
*'By claw and tooth, from root to thorn,
The Old Oak's grove, to wildlings sworn.'*

FrescoFoundingGrove.speaker: Narrator
FrescoFoundingGrove.text: *The mural shows druids claiming the grove in the name of the Old Oak - Silvanus, god of nature.*

VB_EmptyHolder.speaker: Player
VB_EmptyHolder.text: The stone's less worn here. Recently uncovered.

VB_LockedLibrary.speaker: Player
VB_LockedLibrary.text: I can't even see a lock to pick.

VB_ObtainedReward.speaker: Player
VB_ObtainedReward.text: The glaive the druid's notebook mentioned. Its owner thought it was cursed...

session_synopses.FrescoFoundingGrove: Player is examining a mural on the wall of the Druid's Grove, depicting its foundation.
session_synopses.VB_EmptyHolder: Player finds a slot in the wall where you can fit a slab of stone. This is where we'll place a stone rune, if we find one.
session_synopses.VB_LockedLibrary: Player tries to open a stone door, but it's just a blank slab. There's no place for a key.
session_synopses.VB_ObtainedReward: Player finds a glaive in a locked room. Reading a nearby book you might learn it was taken from the Shadow cursed lands by Halsin, who found it was infused with dark power. (It does have a special power - the glaive deals 1d6 extra necrotic damage to characters UNLESS they're standing in sunlight.)

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: You came! I have - here! Mol said I should thank you properly. For the harpies.
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: The kid takes something out of his back pocket. If you can suggest that he's holding a pageoff-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: So I wrote you a story!
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: If you can suggest that he's offering the player a page off-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Player
InHideout.text: Aren't you the clever one? That's very kind.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: Ah - ummm, it's gone. I had it just now, I'm - I'm sorry.

AD_PlayerWarnings.speaker: Player
AD_PlayerWarnings.context: NodeContext: wondering, a little bit in awe.

AD_HarpyAttackedEarly.speaker: Harpy
AD_HarpyAttackedEarly.context: NodeContext: Feral bird-woman - a scream of rage and hunger

session_synopses.InHideout: You encounter the kid you saved from the harpies in the children's hideout. He wants to thank you, but is still a little shy.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerCharmed: AD when the player is charmed by the harpies.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerWarnings: AD played when the player gets close to the harpy situation, warning them that something is amiss.
session_synopses.AD_HarpyAttackedEarly: AD when player attacks the Harpy leader before the proper combat starts
session_synopses.AD_GnomeCharmed: The tiefling kid has been charmed, and is being controlled by a beautiful song that beckons him forth, promising everything will be all right if he follows.
session_synopses.AD_GnomeUncharmed: The tiefling kid wakes up fron his trance, he's panicked and (almost) crying because he's so frightened.

AD_ZorruGuard.speaker: Eramas
AD_ZorruGuard.context: NodeContext: Finding his colleague tiresome for even asking

AD_ZorruGuard.speaker: Zorru
AD_ZorruGuard.text: Just wait 'til you see 'em. Yellow all over. Covered in spots. No noses to speak of.

AD_TieflingKid004.speaker: Zaki
AD_TieflingKid004.text: You're one of those toad-people Zorru saw!

session_synopses.AD_ZorruGuard: Zorru and another tiefling speak. Zorru mentions the gith are after him - Tilses isn't sure they even exist.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingKid004: Tiefling kid recognises Lae'zel as a githyanki via AD

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Hello, petal! Need anything? Any lotions or potions?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Cheerful and sincere. This is her second time meeting the player. Acting like they're friends already.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I need help. I've been infected by a mind flayer parasite.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you recount your adventure, Auntie Ethel nods along - her eyes wide.*
You poor pet. My heart goes out to you, truly.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She clutches her chest, looking incredibly concerned and sympathetic. NodeContext: Deep concern and sounds sincere. Very worried about the player.

node_data.text: I see no sign of a tentacle yet, but that could change in an instant. You need help, serious help.
I've ne'er a potion or lotion here that could do it, but...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking around, concerned as she tries to think of something. Shaking her head.

node_data.text: ...yes. I may have something at home!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes light up. Smiles. NodeContext: Hope and cheer in her voice. She sounds like she genuinely wants to help.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I doubt a simple potion will suffice. This problem calls for strong magic.
Petal, the things I've collected would blow your pretty little mind.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Getting into 'salesman' mode, is trying to entice the player to come to her home.

node_data.text: Bracelets that hold the power of ten men, mirrors that capture the soul...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Ibid.

node_data.text: I'll be heading home soon. Here. Let me mark it on your map - just in case.
node_data.context: NodeContext: almost winking at just in case. Expects player to show up at her home, confident that she's baited them enough.

node_data.text: Oh, and those potions you swiped from me? Keep them - call it a gift from your Auntie Ethel.
See you around, petal.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Amused.

session_synopses: Auntie Ethel appears to be a charmingly roguish old lady selling potions in the grove. She is actually a hag in disguise. The player can explain what happened with the tadpole and Ethel offers to meet them at her home in order to 'help them'. The player can also get poison from her for the goblin camp, but she asks them to do her a favour instead.

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *Your rescue attempt has been noticed. Choose your next move carefully.*

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Player
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: Anyone who wants to hurt Sazza will face me first.

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *You are persuasive enough. You, and the goblin, are free to go.*

GroveConflict_IdolCrime.speaker: Narrator
GroveConflict_IdolCrime.text: *It seems the Idol of Silvanus has been stolen. Choose your next move carefully.*

session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_Crime: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player is trying to smuggle the goblin out of the Druid Grove.
session_synopses.GroveConflict_IdolCrime: The player has stolen a most sacred idol from the druids.Though the druids have made peace with the players and the tieflings at this time, they can't let anyone steal their idol, so they interrogate the player when they see him.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Hells, we can't just leave. They're kin.
Group.context: NodeContext: This is the start of the dialog but clearly an ongoing argument. You think it's your responsibility, as a tiefling, to stay and help your kin. You're angry, voice is level but will soon grow louder, and utterly convinced that staying at the camp is the right thing to do.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: I'll not gamble our lives, our futures, on people who are as good as dead. We must leave for Baldur's Gate - at once.
Group.context: NodeContext: You're angry but your voice is level. You think staying at the camp is essentially suicide. You cannot believe it was even suggested. You and your friends have brand new lives waiting for you in Baldur's Gate - to stay at the camp is reckless and pointless to you.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Can we all just take a moment? Please?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking for one to the other. Stuck in between them, pleading. Hands out as he tries to calm the situation. NodeContext: Your friend and sister are screaming at each other in front of you. Light and easygoing tone as you try to calm the argument.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: What's the point in blades and spells if we don't bloody use them? We should stay.
Group.context: NodeContext: Your voice is getting louder. You're very angry now. It's your civic duty to use the skills you have to help people. You cannot believe how selfish Rolan is being.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: These people aren't fighters. We can help.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Or yell louder. That's fine too.
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sighing as he shrugs. He knows neither is listening to him. NodeContext: Your friend and sister have ignored your plea. You know once they've started they'll just keep arguing until one of them gives in. This is almost said with a shrug and in a light, jokey tone.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You should all stay. A single blade could make a difference.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: No. This place is a death trap. Let us leave - immediately!
Group.context: NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're frustrated and angry. You think it's ludicrous that anyone would disagree with you.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: Or would you deny your brother here his chance at fortune in Baldur's Gate?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Lia but gesturing to Cal. NodeContext: You know the argument is likely going your way and you're being a little bit of a dick here. You know mentioning Lia's brother is a guarantee that she'll give in to your side and leave with you. It's a bit of an underhanded move.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You want fortune? There's coin in it if you stay.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: You know, that money could go towards a spiffy new outfit for your apprenticeship...?
Group.context: NodeContext: Smile, knowing rolan will give in

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Generic 'taking' animation. Taking coin from the player.NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' Frustrated but giving in to the promise of going.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...
Group.context: NodeContext: Kinda sulky but accepting that you'll stay in the grove.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Thank you, Rolan. And thank you, friend.
Group.context: NodeContext: Warm and sincere. Directed at rolan and then player.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: We don't even know these people!
AD.context: NodeContext: Arguing with Lia. He thinks her suggestion to stay is suicide.

AD.speaker: Lia
AD.context: NodeContext: Rolan has claimed you don't even know the other tieflings. You're snapping back.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: Of course it does. You would choose strangers over us!

AD.speaker: Cal
AD.context: NodeContext: You sister and your best friend are arguing and it's getting progressively heated. You're trying to calm the situation but you also know they're going to keep ignoring you.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I can spare but a moment - Baldur's Gate awaits! Oh, I can almost smell the city.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Leaving for Baldur's Gate after a hell of an argument but isn't bothered. Excited to be leaving and seems oblvious to that fact that Lia is next to him, SEETHING.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're cheerful for someone about to abandon his kin.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Well, you're here, aren't you? You can help them if you want.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I don't believe in sacrifices for a lost cause.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: We're leaving for Baldur's Gate. And we will make it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: There's every chance you'll die on the road.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Please. I can handle myself. It's others that are the issue.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: You are looking at Lorroakan's newest apprentice.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Excited, Eyes light up. This is his dream. He believes he is DESTINED for this.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Yes - that Lorroakan. The greatest wizard in Baldur's Gate.
node_data.context: NodeContext: xcited, Eyes light up. This is his dream. He believes he is DESTINED for this.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Never heard of him. Who is he?

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: What? You don't know of him? I've admired him for years.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Pride and awe in his voice. He's clearly imagining himself in the same position.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Both his magic and political sway are forces to be reckoned with.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Rest assured, the names 'Rolan' and 'Lorroakan' will be known to you soon enough. You'll see.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dismissive shrug. Stating this like a fact.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: Those goblins will rue the day they chose to tangle with this grove.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: You and I will do some good here - I can feel it.

session_synopses.Group:
Three people are having an argument. Rolan, Lia and Cal. Lia and Cal are brother and sister, but the three of them have grown up together. They're young, talented tieflings who are heading to Baldur's Gate to start their lives and careers. Rolan argues that they should leave now and get to the city while they still can. Lia argues that it is irresponsible to leave their kin behind. Cal is stuck in the middle.
This is a passionate and fiery argument, both sides are convinced that they are correct.
session_synopses.AD: This occurs betwen Lia, Cal and Ronan. There are mixed ADs which occur - when they're arguing about when to stay and go, when they've decided to stay and when they've decided to go.
session_synopses: This occurs after the argument with Lia. If they're leaving for Baldur's Gate he's pretty relaxed about the argument and dismissive of Lia and her concerns. If they're staying in the grove, he's furious and is convinced they'll die here.
session_synopses.Sister: This occurs after the argument betwen Lia and Rolan. Lia is still stewing after the fight. Opportunity to get to know her better and understand the group dynamics.

node_data.speaker: Tilses
node_data.text: You're the one who helped at the gate? Glad to have another sword - we might need it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sizing you up

session_synopses: A guard outside the prison who can greet the player on their way in/ out.

AD_Trainee1Responses.speaker: Wyll
AD_Trainee1Responses.text: Grind your feet into the ground. Really lock 'em in.

AD_Trainee1Responses.speaker: Wyll
AD_Trainee1Responses.text: Now hold the left arm across your face - and jab with the right.
AD_Trainee1Responses.context: CinematicNodeContext: Umi swings her practice blade.

session_synopses.AD_Trainee1Responses: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Did that...? No, damn it. Still nothing.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Maybe - maybe it just needs time to wear off. Fingers crossed the goblins don't return any time soon.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: You. Saw you fighting those slimy bastards.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowl in hand, paused mid preperation of gruel. Next to a pot with a ladle in hand. Looking at the player, appears annoyed. NodeContext: Gruff sounding. Shouldn't be clear if you're annoyed at the player or not.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds the bowl out to the player. Nods towards it, doesn't expect to be refused. NodeContext: Gruff as you hand the food to the player. Doesn't expect the player to refuse.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: Best to fill your belly now - while we still can.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding the bowl out. NodeContext: Warmth to her voice despite the gruff exterior. She's obviously concerned about the player but is hiding it.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: See how you feel when your pack is empty - it'll be this or a handful of weeds.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrug as Okta pulls the bowl back towards herself. NodeContext: Player has rudely turned down your food. You're annoyed and offended.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: We'll need every bit of strength to make it to Baldur's Gate. Trust me.
RefugeeChef.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is being a spoilt idiot.Sounds very annoyed now.

AD_TieflingGuard1.speaker: Rikka
AD_TieflingGuard1.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's staring at the dead below.NodeContext: Shocked and scared.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts up his head, sniffs the air and goes back to sleep.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear sluggishly gets up. (It moves in scripting, after the dialogue has ended.)

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Glad you made it inside... doubt we'll be safe here for long though.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: twitchy - she's watching the tree-line as she speaks, expecting an attack

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: There'll be more coming. Goblins hunt in packs.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper.text: You could hold off a horde of goblins from this position.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Maybe - but we're not fighters. If they broke through, it'd be a massacre.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: slightly reassured but still anxious

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: The sooner we leave for Baldur's Gate, the better.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper.text: How far are we from the city?

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: If the road was clear? A tenday's walk, maybe. But while the goblins are out there, it might as well be the other side of the world.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: first lines thoughtful - then sadness after 'travel'

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Aradin's back with his tail between his legs. I'm glad for your help, but I'd hoped you were Halsin.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Hells, I didn't mean it that way. Halsin's important, but you're the first bit of good faith we've had since he left.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Keep your wits about you. Things are tense with the druids here.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: Her friend just died unexpectedly.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He was joking about Okta's soup just a moment ago...
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: Her friend just died unexpectedly.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Kaldani
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax Rikka on softly. Rikka is shocked because one of the other guards just died, but they have to bury him and get ready for more goblins. There is no time keep standing around.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: And now what? We dig a hole and be done with him?
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: still trying to come to terms with her friend dying and having to bury him quickly.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Kaldani
AD_CorpseMove.text: We... we could say a prayer. We should have time for that.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: soft, trying to get Rikka to move on and help bury the guard that just died, even if they can't do much.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: Yeah... yeah, that would be good.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: weary, trying to come to terms with everything.

VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.text: *Here lies Zevlor. He saved us when all hope seemed lost. Thank you, friend.*
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

AD_TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_TieflingGuard10.text: Goblins, gnolls... so many ways to die.
AD_TieflingGuard10.context: NodeContext: Morbid jokes about how to die - jovial.

PAD_ShadowheartBook.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBook.text: A temple of Shar? Where? And what's this about a curse?
PAD_ShadowheartBook.context: NodeContext: First she's heard of this temple.

PAD_BearStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_BearStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Forest Father, we are granted balance.*

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: Try it again. I dare you.

PAD_EntranceStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_EntranceStatue.text: *This grove is kept by Silvanus' faithful.*

GruntingKid_Hideout.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_Hideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: with a nod of greetingNodeContext: abrupt greeting

Refugee4.speaker: Toron
Refugee4.text: We should get moving. Goblins are bound to regroup eventually.
Refugee4.context: NodeContext: Glimmer of hope. Eager to get moving.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.context: NodeContext: Putting on a good front, but slightly afraid. Should still sound confident though.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: My friend's blood not enough? Come to rip me open too?
TieflingGuard11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tiefling raises his weapon half-heartedly.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard11.text: You've seen other githyanki? Tell me where - or I'll have your head.
TieflingGuard11.context: InternalNodeContext: Prior to gith chokepoint, otherwise this info is useless to the player so failing this option might have them reload for nothing

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: I'll t-tell you. Just stay back, all right?

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: They were on the road to Baldur's Gate, near the mountain p-pass.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: It saw us 'fore we saw it. Jammed its blade through Yul's belly, straight to the other side.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: And I just... I just ran.

AD_Adventurer02.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer02.text: Damn this. Damn them. Damn everything.

VB_Grave_Kanon.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_Kanon.text: *Here lies Kanon. He gave his life defending others. He will be missed.*
VB_Grave_Kanon.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

Rat.speaker: Narrator
Rat.text: *The rat's eyes soften as he emits a pained squeak.*

Rat.speaker: Narrator
Rat.text: *You realise the source of his discomfort - one of his front teeth is chipped.*

Rat.speaker: Player
Rat.text: Bare your own teeth at him.

Rat.speaker: Narrator
Rat.text: *The rat bristles with an offended hiss.*

AD_TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TieflingGuard4.context: NodeContext: Sighing, she's walking around and noticing more problems than solutions in the grove that has become a refugee camp for her people

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: Glad you were here for those goblins. Picked one off yesterday, myself. Shot her through the throat.
Tiefling001.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's closed off, crossing one arm over the other to hug herself, uncomfortable with what she did.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: That should've killed her, but... she kept gasping. Clawing at the arrow.
Tiefling001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking away absentmindedly, reliving the bad memories.

Tiefling001.speaker: Player
Tiefling001.text: Your first kill? Don't worry - it gets easier.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: That's what Zevlor said, too. I hope you're right.
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: She's trying to be hopeful, but still has doubts.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: I want to help - I just didn't think it would feel like this.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Used to think the goblins'd kill us the second we set foot outside. But after hearing what you did at the gate...

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: ... well, I still think they'll kill us. But at least we can put up a fight.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: Try not to keel over with the first blade drawn.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Well, we came through Avernus. We might not look it, but we're tough.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Who knows, some of us might even make it to Baldur's Gate.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: Maybe you'll catch a glimpse of Baldur's Gate before they cut you down.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Ohh, well aren't you an optimist?

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: I've seen what the goblins can do to a vulnerable caravan, so I'm not as confident.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: But if you are, why not put a little gold on the line? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: No? Shame, I thought you might enjoy a little fun.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Be safe out there, whatever comes your way.

PAD_WolfStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_WolfStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Treefather, our turmoil is calmed.*

AD_TieflingGuard3.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3.text: What I'd do for some salt...
AD_TieflingGuard3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over cooking pot - cooking. NodeContext: Slightly gruff. Talking to herself.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: Another one. What are you under there, then? Ant? Aurochs?

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: The keepers of this place. They change their form to fit their need.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: They become birds, to hunt on the wing. Bears, to tear flesh with teeth. But for me - only oxen. Only same old hay.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: And I cannot even eat it, because the horned ones hide their shiny bits inside.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: Your kind give us your burdens. But who will carry ours?

GruntingKid.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid.text: *He stares right past you as if you're invisible. Or boring.*

GruntingKid.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid.context: CinematicNodeContext: noddingNodeContext: A YES grunt.

GruntingKid.speaker: Player
GruntingKid.text: Turn around to see what has his attention.

GruntingKid.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid.text: *You see nothing out of the ordinary.*
GruntingKid.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a full turn-around. The character should credibly be able to see the grunting kid out of the corner of their eye.

GruntingKid.speaker: Narrator
GruntingKid.text: *As you turn back, the child slips between the rocks.*

PAD_ElkStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_ElkStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Old Oak, all death begets life.*

AD_Refugee4.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee4.text: Can't keep the goblins out forever. This is no fortress, and we're no warriors.

AD_TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard8.text: Should be safe to travel now.

GraveDig.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig.text: *Freshly turned soil shifts beneath your feet as you approach the grave.*
GraveDig.context: NodeContext: The player has approached the grave of the very recently deceased.

GraveDig.speaker: Player
GraveDig.text: Bow your head and silently pay your respects.

GraveDig.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig.text: *You close your eyes, finding a moment of peace.*
GraveDig.context: NodeContext: The player is paying their respects at a grave. Should be quiet and filled with reverence.

session_synopses.TieflingGuard5: She drank a potion given to her by the hag, with the promise that it would make her strong as steel. It did, but it has paralysed her legs. The effects are temporary, but she's angry and embarassed at the situation she's found herself. She doesn't suspect any foul play on the hag's part. We get a clue about this mysterious old woman selling potions in the cave, and through tagged gameplay can reveal that she's been duped. She is frustrated at herself - she wanted to help in the goblin fight, and instead she is sprawled on the ground.
session_synopses.RefugeeChef: An older woman, responsible for feeding an entire camp of refugees before they leave. She is gruff but has a heart of gold. She offers the player some gruel. Purpose is to highlight how desperate their situation is.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard1: AD for a shelshocked tiefling patrolling the bridge and looking at the dead below. Older tiefling.
session_synopses.PAD_ElevatorUnusable: VB when the player clicks on the elevator, but it's blocked by the bear lying on top of it.
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: A bear is sleeping on the elevator, blocking it off from use. She's very tired and doesn't want to get up
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Tiefling in charge of operating the gate at the druid's grove. She saw goblins attack and saw the player(s) help to repel them. She's nervous that more attacks will be coming and that the grove's defenses won't hold, which makes her eager to get on the road to Baldur's Gate as soon as possible.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard4: Non-critpath. A tiefling who sees the confrontation with a human adventurer at the grove as part of a systemic prejudice against tieflings. He carelessly led goblins to a grove full of tiefling children, and she doesn't think he'd have done that if there were humans there.
session_synopses.AD_CorpseMove: Two tieflings standing over the body of their killed comrade, about to bury him. Rikka is frustrated and angry in her grief, Kaldani tries to be the voice of reason.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_TieflingLeader: This is the grave of Zevlor, the tiefling leader. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBook: Shadowheart reads a book in the druid grove that suggests theres' a temple dedicated to her patron goddess somewhere in the region.
session_synopses.PAD_BearStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.Squirrel: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the squirrel communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the squirrel speaks like a human. She shouldn't sound like a disney animal. She's serious about getting the player to leave - she sees them as a threat - but she's also cocky about it. She doesn't think she'll have any problem beating the player the player to a pulp.Players encounter the squirrel in the druid grove. For all he knows, they're encroaching on HER territory, and she wants them out. Players have several options to deal with him in SwA - persuading or intimidating her. In both versions, they can kick her to death, if they choose.
session_synopses.PAD_EntranceStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.GruntingKid_Hideout: Non-critpath. A child who speaks solely in grunts in the thiefling hiedout.
session_synopses.Refugee4: A refugee, anxious about the goblins beyond the gates and the druids within.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard11: Tiefling is afraid of githyanki - he's seen one gut his friend while they were scouting.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer02: A gruff adventurer complains about being stuck in a grove full of refugees. Wants to get back to the city. Speaking to himself. Grumbling.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_Kanon: This is the grave of Kanon, the tiefling who died at the gate of the grove. He was killed by goblins. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.AD_Gatekeeper: A tiefling refugee stands watch on a battlement, unnerved and unsettled. Also has a line for her relief when the danger is gone - 'we can finallly leave'.
session_synopses.Rat: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the rat communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the rat speaks like a human. He can have some rat-like tendencies in hs delivery, but he shouldn't have a squeaky voice or come across comical.Players encounter the rat in the druid grove. He's in pain, with a chipped tooth. He chipped it on an item in a nearby chest. If players are nice to him, he'll lead them to the chest. If players remove the item, the rat excitedly jumps into the chest.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard4: Thie tiefling refugee is trying to keep an optimistic view of things, but as she walks around the grove that they're using as a shelter, she sees too many problems and not enough solutions
session_synopses.Tiefling001: This tiefling recently killed a goblin and is trying to progress the grueling death she caused. She's trying to be strong, but is deeply traumatized. Depending on the player's answer, she'll express her frustration at not being able to deal with it,be shocked, or sink deeper into depression.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard10: A Tiefling in the druid grove who's keen to banter and joke. She's a bit flirtatious, though there's an undercurrent of fear throughout it all. She's genuinely afraid that she's going to die, and her only coping mechanism is to joke about it - in this case offering to make a bet. She's looking for something to look forward to.RERECORD NOTES: All lines in that dialogue have been set to rerecord with a few line changes. Overall direction. she needs to a more tongue in cheek humorous delivery.
session_synopses.PAD_WolfStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard3: Okta is leaning over her cooking pot, trying to make something edible as she mutters to herself.
session_synopses.Mule1: The ox is waiting in the cave while the tieflings decide whether to return to the road or not. He has been watching the druids in the grove below, and how they can change into any form they wish. He's wistful and sulky, wishing he could change his own shape from an ox to something less subservient.He can give us a hint about an item stashed in his hay.
session_synopses.GruntingKid: Non-critpath. A child who speaks solely in grunts. He will disappear into a hidden hatch in the ground the first time he's encountered. He will return a day later and the player can convince him to reveal the hidden entrance if they're careful.
session_synopses.PAD_ElkStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee4: Waiting for an attack of goblins on the druid grove. On edge.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard8: Ikaron either comments on the fact that the goblins have been defeated, or that they tiefligns have already bene attacked.
session_synopses.GraveDig: This occurs in the DEN. The dead can be Kanon, Aradin or Zevlor. It is a recently made grave.

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Step, parry, strike - damn it! It's just not... agh!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trying and failing at swordplay practiceNodeContext: Frustrated. Practicing swordplay with little success - then reacts with alarm upon seeing a gith

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Sorry, sorry. I've just never seen... your face is... well. I should get back to it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Apologising, A little unnerved by a gith

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Interesting technique. Having some trouble?

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Nothing but. Goblins in the wilds, out for blood. And the druids in here, looking to kick us out - or worse.
node_data.context: NodeContext: unloading his burdens

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: We need to be ready for a fight - but I'm useless with a sword.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'I'm doing my best, but my best isn't good enough'

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Demonstrate a swing - show him the fluidity of movement he lacks.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player mimics a sword swing.

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Like this, you mean? Step-step, strike! Yes!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Practicing his swing.NodeContext: Successful attempt

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: I'll try and brace them better - like so. Step-brace, parry, swing! Yes!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Practicing his swing.NodeContext: Successful attempt

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Good advice - If I had two copper, I'd owe you one.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful (but he has nothing to give the player)

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: You really know what you're doing! Found this by the road - bet you'll put it to good use.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: Tiefling is practicing his swing on  a dummy, trying to improve. The player can offer advice, potentially improving the tiefling's form.

session_synopses.Dead: In this dialogue, Volo has died and is a lifeless corpse. Rather than his usual jocular self, he's a shade who can hardly speak.

002.speaker: Silver
002.text: Another stranger come to vex me. What will you do? Hunt me? Grab my tail? Shout until my head hurts?
002.context: NodeContext: This is a wild animal and the wrong move might endanger us

002.speaker: Player
002.text: Relax. No one is here to hurt you.

002.speaker: Silver
002.text: Stupid or a liar. Neither is needed here. Go!

004.speaker: Tusk
004.text: Hmph. I thought you were Halsin.

004.speaker: Narrator
004.text: *The boar prances around, haunches clenching and unclenching impatiently.*
004.context: NodeContext: the player is describing the feelings of a tame boar that is hoping we've brought it something it craves - it's quite desperate

004.speaker: Tusk
004.text: Where's Halsin? He promised me a mate!

session_synopses.002: An aggravated wolf in a druid grove. He has learned obedience from Rath but is still a wild thing at heart. There are newcomers to his home and his instincts tell him to chase them away, to harm them, but he's not allowed to. He's like a coiled spring, ready to strike.
session_synopses.004: A tame boar in the druid grove who craves the company of his own kind
session_synopses.AD_004: Animal sound AD for pet boar in druid grove

PAD_Comment.speaker: Player
PAD_Comment.text: Looks like the ritual worked. The whole grove is walled in.
PAD_Comment.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Sad. tieflings trapped inside.

PAD_Attack.speaker: Player
PAD_Attack.text: It'd take an age to hack through all this.

session_synopses.PAD_Comment: This VB plays when players first see the results of a druid ritual: indestructible vines have enveloped the entire grove, sealing it off from the outside world. Players cannot get past them to the grove within.
session_synopses.PAD_Attack: This VB plays when players attack the indestructible vines that have enveloped a druid's grove.

AD.speaker: Shadowheart
AD.text: Ugh, no matter. As long as I keep the damn thing safe.
AD.context: NodeContext: Talking to herself, trying to figure out a mysterious artefact.

session_synopses.AD: Shadowheart tries to figure out the mysterious cube that she carries with her while resting in the Druid Grove (the cube is a powerful relic that she was to retrieve deliver to her superiors - she does not know its exact nature, but has to protect it at all costs).

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.context: InternalNodeContext: Remember he could have been KO by Aradin. The flag PostConfrontationDone will make him move after the dialogNodeContext: mrag-RESH-em. Means 'shithead' in infernal. Zevlor has just woken up after being punched in the face by Aradin. He's groggy and pissed off.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: A cheap shot - to be expected from a drow. But you helped us, so instead of killing you, I'll just ask:
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Sneering, barely keeping his temper in check

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Who in the Nine Hells do you think you are?

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: I'll survive a sore jaw. What I won't tolerate is a stranger waltzing in here and interfering in our business.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Lucky for you, you seem to have spooked that adventurer trash into leaving.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Whatever your business, I'd see to it quickly - the druids are forcing everyone out.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Cautionary - his people are also being forced out

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: This attack will only strengthen their resolve.

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: I won't be staying long - I just need to find a healer.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: They've started a ritual to cut the grove off from the world outside.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Weary, doesn't know what to do

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: This ritual - is there no way to convince the druids to stop it?

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: I've tried. Kagha - their new First Druid - won't even see me.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: You, though... I know it's not your business, but she owes you for saving this place.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Slowly and thoughtfully - considering you, idea just occurring to him

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Perhaps you could persuade her. For more time to prepare, if nothing else.

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: I'll see what I can do.

session_synopses.DenIntro: In these dialogues, Zevlor reflects on what's happened (an attack of goblins at the gate, which the player helped with) and his mistrust of and bitterness towards the druids who are reluctantly hosting his people. He is exasperated, furious, but also eager to meet anyone who could help.
