He'll show a flash of anger and frustration at the start if the player struck him, but is pragmatic enough to calm himself once he realises you could be more help to him than harm.

AD_LookingForInstrument.speaker: Alfira
AD_LookingForInstrument.text: No, no, no. It was right here.
AD_LookingForInstrument.context: NodeContext: Frantic and panicked as you search for your instrument.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Dance upon the stars tonight. Smile and pain will fade away. Words of mine will change - no. Become - ugh.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lightly strumming her lute. Not looking at the player. NodeContext: Softly singing. Sadness in every note. There is a small pause between every line as you softly sing.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: What's that tune you're singing?

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: More like butchering. Don't know why I bother.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at lute - frustratedNodeContext: Speaking of her own music. Embarassed and frustrated with herself. Dejected.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Are you all right?

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: No. I'm moments away from a grisly death...
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at player. NodeContext: Sarcasm mixed with frustation.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: ...at the hands of this bloody song. I can't... nothing fits, you know?
Bard.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Why are you songwriting now? Hardly the best time.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I... we lost people on the way here.
Bard.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: And the dead deserve to be remembered. That's what my teacher always said.
Bard.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: This grove could become a battlefield soon enough. It's not the time for music.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I know. I should be packing up, but I need to finish this song. It's... it's important.
Bard.context: NodeContext: Player has advised her to leave. But she can't - she has to finish her song. Frustrated, mainly at herself.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Snatch the lute out of her hands and smash it.
True
CinematicNodeContext: Player grabs the lute out of Alfira's hands and smashes it on the ground.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grabs the lute out of Alfira's hands and smashes it on the ground.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: What did you do?! My teacher gave me that! And she - and she's dead, you bastard.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stands up. NodeContext: Player smashed your lute - you're hysterical and furious.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I wanted to write a song for her and you - you ruined it. You ruined everything.

AD_StartingOver.speaker: Alfira
AD_StartingOver.context: NodeContext: Player has convinced her to start from scratch with the song. Doubts herself. Hates what she's working on. Dejected.

AD_InstrumentBroken.speaker: Alfira
AD_InstrumentBroken.context: NodeContext: Player has broken her precious lute. You're upset and yelling at the player.

AD_Dejected.speaker: Alfira
AD_Dejected.context: NodeContext: She has 'lost' her instrument (player stole it). You are on the brink of tears, feeling lost and ashamed - you wanted to write a song for your teacher, and now you never will. You feel like a failure.

AD_ComposingSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong.text: When you call the last light...
AD_ComposingSong.context: NodeContext: Hesitantly singing the song, feeling out the words as you compose.

AD_ComposingSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong.context: NodeContext: Hesitant as you try to figure out the song.

AD_ComposingSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_ComposingSong.context: NodeContext: Frustrated - feeling like a failure.

session_synopses.AD_LookingForInstrument: The bard is looking for her instrument in the vicinity of her playing spot.
session_synopses.Bard:
Alfira is a young bard who was apprenticed to a woman called Lihala. On their journey to the camp, they were attacked by gnolls, and Lihala died horribly.
Alfira is trying to compose a song in honour of the teacher she loved so dearly, but is struggling. The player can help her play, talk ther through the lyrics, steal her instrument, or even convince her to give up music.
This is a very soft and touching moment in the grove. Should Alfira finish her song (with the aid of the player) she will stand up and sing it in a cinematic scene.
session_synopses.AD_StartingOver: AD that plays after the bard has been told to start over. She is holding her lute. Not plucking it occasionally but not really playing.
session_synopses.AD_InstrumentBroken: The bars is sitting alone - crying. Player has broken her instrument.
session_synopses.AD_Dejected: Dejected/crying because her instrument was stolen or smashed by a player.
session_synopses.AD_ComposingSong: The bard is struggling to come up with a song to accompany her lute.

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

SnakesCourt.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing.speaker: Player
Denouncing.text: The Shadow Druids are taking over - the circle is overdue some change.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation.text: Odd - someone's cut a notch in the tree there.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Mercy on us, Silvanus - mercy, mercy, mercy.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: That snake must be held accountable.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: By every star, by every vein on every leaf, she must.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: This has only happened because our true leader was taken from us.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: Kagha seems happy to rule the roost. Who's your real leader?

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Master Halsin. Perhaps goblin-caught, perhaps dead. He'd set... Mistress Kagha back in line. Hold her to task. Stop this damned ritual.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: More will die if the rite is finished. So many more, sent into a world gone mad...

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: If no one's looking for Halsin, I could do it.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Would you? I would give anything to see Halsin return home.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Your dismissal is no shield. Kagha will ensure all outsiders are driven from the grove.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Should you change your mind, head west. Halsin is an elf with the presence of a bear.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: Shadow Druids? There's more to Kagha than meets the eye.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: It's time we had a talk with her, don't you think?

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: Go on. Say it. You think I'm a monster.

Leader.speaker: Wyll
Leader.text: Monster? Too kind. A demon, more like.

Leader.speaker: Player
Leader.text: You're protecting your own - sometimes cruelty is required.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: First you urge grace. Then you speak truth. You've surprised me twice over.

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: A shame the grace period ends. The viper's fangs have been bared. She must guard her brood.

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Rath
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She's dead. Kagha, we are guardians, not killers!

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Kagha
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She knew the danger. She still tried to run.

LeaderSaved.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved.text: I have been so blind, that an outsider would show me the way of Silvanus.

LeaderSaved.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved.text: After all I've done, you've no reason to believe me, but... I'm grateful.

LeaderSaved.speaker: Kagha
LeaderSaved.text: I will cancel the rite and subject myself to the circle for judgement.

session_synopses.AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.
session_synopses.SnakesCourt: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.
session_synopses.Denouncing: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundSecretLocation: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.
session_synopses.001: Shadow Druid in rat shape. Trying to use speak with animals or animal handling results in nothing.
session_synopses.Opposed: Rath is a human druid opposed to Kagha, who has taken control of the grove in Halsin's absence. He is a kind, determined man, who seeks to keep nature in balance and prevent violence at all costs.
session_synopses.AD_CallWolf: Silver, Rath's wolf companion, is wandering away from him. He calls the wolf back. Patient and affectionate tone.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter: Player found and read the recruitment letter that Kagha got from the Shadow Druids.
session_synopses.Leader: Player speaks with Kagha, the secret Shadow druid. Various paths of conversation reflect whether Kagha's actions led to a child's death or not. She may be neutral/Machiavellian or pure evil, depending.
session_synopses.AD_ReactToDeadKid: Rath reacts to the tiefling girl being killed by Sagha's snake. Sagha responds coldly.
session_synopses.LeaderSaved: Kagha's dialog after the Celebration (post-AttackOnDen or post-GoblinHunt), if the scene with the parents occured and the player saved her.CAMP_GoblinHuntCelebration_Event_SavedKagha = true

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*we will find truth in dream*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You stare into the eye. Your reflection stares back.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The longer you stare, the more uneasy you feel. There is a presence. You are seen.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye more intensely

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Reach out to the presence.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your consciousness surges into the orb. First there is blackness - then a pair of unblinking, red eyes.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Pain grips your skull as the eyes stare into you - then look away. The connection is broken.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grips their head in pain, then releases it.

session_synopses: Player clicks on the scrying eye patrolling in Grymdark. Passing an Insight check lets you look back into the presence watching you (one of the scryers at Moonrise Towers). This dialogue uses the same template as the dialogue with the scrying eye in the goblin camp.

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*
Looted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Surveying a group of Skeletons clad in Dark Justiciar uniforms (in game objects exist).

Looted.speaker: Player
Looted.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *You immediately recognise the symbol of your Lady. You know these uniforms.*

Looted.speaker: Narrator
Looted.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, an honorary order within the priesthood of Shar.*

Looted.speaker: Player
Looted.text: I hope whatever killed them is still around. I will not have it soil Shar's name.

Looted.speaker: Karlach
Looted.text: Be careful what you wish for, soldier.

session_synopses.Looted: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.

Rothe_002.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002.text: Grey ones gone. Good. Will stay here, until it's safe to leave.
Rothe_002.context: NodeContext: Glad captors are gone - good riddance (the duergar could be dead or ordered to go elsewhere)

Rothe_002.speaker: Player
Rothe_002.text: How about breaking through that rubble for me?

Rothe_002.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002.text: For killing grey ones - yes. I will do this.

session_synopses.Rothe_002: Panicky and bestial. A one-liner deep rothe speak with animals dialogue. It's being used by duergar to clear rocks, only it and another rothe have been unsettled by strange noises and stopped responding to their masters. It can be calmed so it can return to its work (the act of calming occurs when speaking to the othe rothe, whom this one takes its cues from).

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Kettel
node_data.text: One step closer an' you're fish food.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

PAD_IdolLooted.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_IdolLooted.text: An idol of Lady Shar. It's beautiful... Curious that I found it. Not the first sign of the Dark Lady's power that I've encountered.
PAD_IdolLooted.context: NodeContext: Admiring and intrigued. (SH is loyal to shar and known to worship her)

session_synopses.PAD_IdolLooted: Party loots the Idol of Shar.

AD_BeckonPlayer.text: To me! I shall guide thee.

ResistMadness.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness.text: *A giggle almost erupts from your throat. This moment strikes you as terribly funny.*
Mine curse hast become thine. Hehe hehee - alack!

ResistMadness.speaker: Player
ResistMadness.text: Stifle the strange sense of glee.

ResistMadness.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness.text: *The joy fades as quickly as it came.*

session_synopses.AD_BeckonPlayer: An amulet calls out to the player amid the rocks surrounded by lava in Grymforge.
session_synopses.ResistMadness: Player has left the camp. A few moments later, they are overcome with an unnatural sense of cheer. If they fail the check, they will fall over in laughter every time they use the amulet's special power that day.The madness has several levels.

PAD_RecogniseStashLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_RecogniseStashLocation.text: Looks like the place the Dark Justiciar's letter mentioned. But where's the stash?

PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.speaker: Player
PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.text: Must be in one of these chests.

session_synopses.PAD_RecogniseStashLocation: The party has read a Harper's letter and has arrived where they expect their stash to be.
session_synopses.PAD_RecogniseWatchword: The Sharran Inquisitor's diary documents the Harper Spy's interrogation. The spy is quoted reciting a Harper Watchword during the interrogation. Players that pass a History Check will recognise the watchword, and understand that the Light spell is required to bypass the spy's trap
session_synopses.PAD_KnowStashIsHidden: Note: this PAD follows directly from either RecogniseStashLocation or FoundRune. See Kevin V. with any questions, I know it is a bit weird.--------When the player recognises that the Harper rune in Ketheric City is marking a hidden stash, they make an Investigation check. On success, they realise that the Harpers would be smart enough not to leave their stash in plain sight - the goal of this hint is to deter the player from interacting with the mimics in the area and to instead look around for a hidden stash somewhere

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Derryth Bonecloak, a dwarven alchemist from Baldur's Gate who came to the Underdark along with her husband, Baelen, in search of a rare and valuable mushroom - the noblestalk.

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: Thanks again for offing that drow. Only made it here 'cause of you. But I can't stop thinking about the rest of us...

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: ... stuck in Moonrise with a bunch of sadists. Poor bastards.

session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome foreman on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Mentions the other gnomes being kept at moonrise towers.

session_synopses.BottomFairyRingActivationCinematic: Cinematic dialog. Shows the activation process for a Fairy Ring.Before the dialogue: the player approaches an active (has vfx) fariy mushroom ring. The dialogue starts. The camera shows the ring and the player (or only the ring) and then rotats and looks down, at another fairy mushroom ring which is inactive, it has no vfx. The VFX activates for the bottom ring, emphasizing activation. End of the cinematic.

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: lava is disappearing from the floor
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: lava is disappearing from the floor

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: the golem is awakening in the pipe
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: the golem is awakening in the pipe

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: the golem burst out from the pipe and open the grill gate
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: the golem burst out from the pipe and open the grill gate

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: player reaction to the threat
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: player reaction to the threat

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.

session_synopses.AdamantineGolemSpawn: After a party member opens the valve that pours lava out of on the forging platform, a golem climbs out of the pipes, attacking them.Note: The valve can be activated by (ranged) attacks and spells, so party member positioning is not guaranteed.Note 2: Party members who are not players can activate the valve.

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Be welcome in this house. I wait for your commands.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: The robot talks to a new person he hasn't talked to before while in peace mode. He bows.

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Command as you see fit, my lord, my liege.

Automaton.speaker: Gale
Automaton.text: Don't get me wrong. I love poetry as much as the next wizard, but using it to command an automaton... seems a bit self-indulgent to me.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: Annoyed he didn't think of it

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: An unbeknownst command that I cannot fulfil.

AD_GaleEntrance.speaker: Gale
AD_GaleEntrance.text: A wizard's tower is his sanctum, a private place for research and respite. But as this wizard's not home - I say we take a peek.
AD_GaleEntrance.context: NodeContext: At first solemn/reverential. Then delighted you're about to snoop around.

session_synopses.Automaton: This is an old robot guarding the top of a deserting tower. His master programmed him to speak in verse. He talks mostly in iambic pentameter (though sometimes in iambic hexameter) - think shakespearian verse.Translator node: this dialogue is linked to other poems in the game, and uses the same words. For more information, please read the 'Riddles and word puzzles of note' doc!
session_synopses.AD_GaleEntrance: Gale enters the Arcane Tower for the first time

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: ((*I will not cross. painful memories beyond*))

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: Don't worry, we'll stay here for now.

session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Raft: Glut says he cannot follow you across the lake, and must remain on shore.

HighPriest.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
HighPriest.text: You've slain the pretender! We knew in our hearts the god BOOOAL was false.
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: In awe of you, rushing to affirm his faith - and absolutely means it

HighPriest.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
HighPriest.text: But you - we see you. We know you by your true name... MAHKLOOMPAH!
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: Kuo-Toa give overwrought, nonsensical names to their gods. Air of great ceremony as he bestows one on you

session_synopses.AD_FishChanting: Fanatical chanting at the altar of a murder god, a crowd heard from afar rather than direct dialogue. This dialog has no lines that are spoken by the character - the lines are intended to be subtitles for the SFX
session_synopses.HighPriest: The Zealot is a Kuo Toa obsessed with his new god - you. You've slain the 'pretender' he was just as dedicated to only moments before, and he's transferred all that zealotry to you.Mahkloompah = ma-KLOOM-pa.

PAD_Reaction.speaker: Player
PAD_Reaction.context: NodeContext: Facing off against a large monster that's just burst out of the ground. Said with focus and determination, rather than fear.

session_synopses.PAD_Reaction: The bulette appears for a second time in the Underdark and is going to attack the players. Said with focus and determination rather than fear.

AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Gekh Coal
AD_CombatTurn.text: I am pain, I am torment, I am death.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: You're not sun-scum. You should know not to make that much noise.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A low growl.

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His gnarled fist grips an axe.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand doesn't need to have attention drawn to it.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His fist grips an axe. On his gnarled, grey skin, you see the Absolute's brand.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand visible if possible (or just leave it to the narrator)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Turn to leave.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: You're a liability, hook-bait. I'll decide how many steps and breaths you've got left.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'One more step, and you're dead'. Hook-bait refers to a hook horrors - a species of predatory beast in the underdark, which might be attracted by the player's noise.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His fist grips an axe. On his gnarled, grey skin, you see the Absolute's brand.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand visible if possible (or just leave it to the narrator)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Stand down. I am a True Soul.
True

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: ... that's right. You are a True Soul.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon lowered a littleNodeContext: Weapon lowered a little

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Not like me to overlook one of the Absolute's Chosen. Let myself get distracted...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks in the direction of this quarry - the myconid circle/injured gnome - with contemplation

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Won't happen again.
node_data.context: NodeContext: The closest thing to an apology that Gekh can manage.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Anyway. The hunt's not over yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What hunt? Explain yourself.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Tracking a runaway slave - deep gnome. Stole boots from my sergeant.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: I'm to kill the runaway - but she's holed up with myconids.
node_data.context: NodeContext: My-con-ids. Spits out the word with some venom - we'll soon learn the myconids killed some of his squad.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Can't get past those rotflowers. They get in your head, make you see things. Half my squad jumped off a cliff, laughing.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Referring to psychic attacks by sentient mushrooms. Not the sort of fight he's used to.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll help you.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Good. Can't let some runt make fools o' the Absolute's warriors.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Bet a True Soul can make those mushrooms choke on their spores.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: I'll keep watch here. Gnome might make a run for it.

Henchmen_Surprised.speaker: Player
Henchmen_Surprised.text: Hold up your palms in peace.

Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.text: I will split your corpse and roast the pieces!

session_synopses: A duergar scout sent by his superior to track down an escaped deep gnome slave and retrieve the valuable Boots of Speed that she stole from the scout's superior. His progress has been hampered as the escapee his hiding amongst some myconids - fungal creatures with telepathic powers. He confronts the player, who may convince him they aren't a threat. They may be able to assist him agains the runaway and myconids, or could betray him, In general, Gekh is a gruff, vicious type. If the player convinces him that they're his superior (a true soul, for instance) he'll show a little more deference.
session_synopses.Henchmen_Surprised: An alternate intro to the Gekh Coal scene, where the player manages to sneak up on Gekh's henchmen before Gekh himself managed to confront the player. They call for his attention.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Fonmara
node_data.text: An outsider. Just what we needed.

session_synopses: Baelan, a mushroom hunter,  is surrounded by dangeous Bibberbang mushrooms. He was trying to get to the Noblestalk mushroom, but one of the stone ledges collapsed underneath him and he fell down. His partner Derryth (Dwarven Alchemist) is in the Myconid Village. Important: Baelan seems to have trouble keeping his train of thought - he loses track of his responses, changes the subject and generally seems out of sorts at times. Later, it will be confirmed that he's been suffering from a dementia-like condition for some years now.
session_synopses.Dead: Baelen was out hunting Noblestalk when he was trapped in a field of explosive mushrooms. He's now dead - most likely because the player triggered those mushrooms to explode. He speaks in short, cryptic fragments from beyond the grave.

002.speaker: Ward Pistle
002.text: You don't need nothing I've got.

session_synopses.002: Surly female duergar, lazy and trying to live the good life using her gnome slave. This dialogue occurs after she and her companion have ordered the duergar around.

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.ServantDuergar1: Player tries speaking with an enthralled duergar. Duergar players get an option to go hostile afterwards.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_003: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_000_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.DeadMyconid_Dead: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.
session_synopses.MushroomField_Warning: Myconid warns you that mushrooms explode if you get too close.
session_synopses.InjuredGnome: STATE NODES - first half of dialogue, Thulla is in EXTREME pain, speaking in short, terse sentences.Second half - she's weary but recovering.Thulla is a member of the Ironhand Gnomes, a group of militant gnomish artificers who came to the Underdark to find a forbidden - and extremely secret - formula for runepowder: an explosive of awesome power.Thulla is a true believer in the cause - when her group was captured by duergar, she escaped but picked up a poisoned wound on the way. She's slowly succumbing to poison - initially vague and feverish. If we heal her, she's exhausted but straight back on task, giving us the job of freeing her people.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer: Omeluum is a friendly, neutral mind flayer and member of the Society of Brilliance, dedicated to improving life in the Underdark. If attacked, it will teleport away rather than engaging in combat.
session_synopses.DirectToSovereign_HookHorror: If you speak to a myconid after the guards speak to you but you have not yet spoken to the sovereign, his voice will speak through them.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Leave: You try to leave the underdark with your myconid companion, and he's having none of it.

session_synopses.CINE_SpectatorReveal: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. A spectator rises from a chasm.
session_synopses.004: This drow was petrified by a spectator.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard. He should seem in shock. Short sentences, short delivery.Leave after a long rest.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *A chill runs through you. Your magic - the fire that burns within is... fading.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at their hands in surprise

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Close your eyes. Breathe into the feeling.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *Your magic gently and effortlessly flows from you - and into the sussur flower.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes at beginning of line, head tilted back, as if enjoying the sensation

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *For the first time in memory, you're without magic. You feel...*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: InternalNodeContext: No one to include, so speaker 1 is the only speaker in this dialog.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Indifferent. If your power is truly yours it will return to you.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *With or without your powers you're at ease. Magic cannot be tamed - not even by you.*

session_synopses.IVB_Aura_Sorcerer: A player sorcerer has this dialog as a special reaction to the first encounter with the sussur flower's aura that drains magic. This is about roleplay and your party - this might be the first time the player has ever been without magic. Companions can be supportive/insulting/etc.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A slender drow blade impales the stone before you, keeping a silent vigil.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise your goddess' rite - a warrior's sacrifice. Only blood, freely given, will honour the fallen.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grab the sword with both hands and pull.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *It feels like you're warring with ten people for the blade, but with another hard yank, the weapon slips free from the stone.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: character struggles with sword, but eventually pulls it out. what a feat of strength!

session_synopses: Player discovers an improvised shrine to a dead drow warrior. There's a helmet resting on a sword that's been rammed into a stone. You can take the helmet, but you'll need to think of another way to get the sword free.

01.speaker: Danna
01.text: Last time I trust a drow hoon.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Narrator
LootingCorpse.text: *Deep gnomes - killed under the yoke of slavers.*
LootingCorpse.context: CinematicNodeContext: Panning over small field of dead bodies.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Player
LootingCorpse.text: I will take the lives of those who took yours.

session_synopses.LootingCorpse: Player having a contemplative moment while observing the corpses of dead gnomes.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: You got those boots? Or something else eatin' at you?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: A few of your clanmates are plotting to kill Nere.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Let me guess - Brithvar and Kur. They've been a thorn in my arse since Nere hired us.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Ignore dumb and dumber. They'd jump down a well if they though there was gold at the bottom.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Nere can handle himself. Reason I joined - I know which way the lava flows.

session_synopses: The duergar sergeant responsible for the camp while Nere is trapped. She's yelling at the gnomes and is considerably pissed off. After realising you are a True Soul, she asks you to help free Nere from the cave-in, and you can refuse or accept. You might turn in her missing boots if you have found them You can also ask about the gnome that escaped and the scrying eye.

DuergarBoatAtCave.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat sits in the water

DuergarBoatAtCave.text: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.

session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCave: Dialogue when clicking on boat in cave to reach Grymforge. Player can stay or cross. This dialogue only appears once player has already been to Grymforge.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Whatever. I'm not afraid of the dark.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Well you should be. That stuff will end you in two flaps of a batwing.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Would you look at that, Kur. Someone's having a listen.
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar turns and notices player. Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers.text: *A shiver runs through you. Your mind is awash in ancient resentments.*
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_03.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *The two rothé moan quietly as lights flash about their heads.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The two Rothé paw the ground in irritation as lights flash about their heads.*

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *The rothé grunt softly at each other. Small lights flash about their heads in quick, erratic patterns.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small lights flashing above rothe heads

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Player
RotheDiscussion.text: Still your body and quietly observe.

RotheDiscussion.speaker: Narrator
RotheDiscussion.text: *One beast notices you and dulls his lights, ending the conversation.*
RotheDiscussion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Elder Rothe dulls his lights

RebelGreedyExtort.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort.text: Freeze it, cock-stench. We aren't done just yet.

RebelGreedyExtort.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort.text: Nere and his Absolute wanks owed us a wad of coin. And the dregs on his corpse aren't gonna cut it.

RebelGreedyExtort.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort.text: Pay up, and you get to slink away. Resist, and I gut you. ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

RebelGreedyExtort.speaker: Player
RebelGreedyExtort.text: You've got this backwards. You keep your head, and I pay you nothing.

RebelGreedyExtort.speaker: Elder Brithvar
RebelGreedyExtort.text: That was the wrong answer. Zavagh!
RebelGreedyExtort.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

Rothe_02.speaker: Elder Rothé
Rothe_02.text: The Ketheric Thorm. The rocks hear, and tremble.

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.RotheDiscussion: This occurs between two Rothe. The first is a younger Rothe who desires  freedom and a life without pain. The other Rothe is older and more stern. He has worked since the times of Ketheric.Player can speak with them or listen in on their conversation with an animal handling check.
session_synopses.RebelGreedyExtort: In this dialogue, you have killed Nere without doing the duergar mutineers quest. As a result, they want you to pay for the trouble you've caused. You can give them money, persuade them to let you live, or attack.
session_synopses.Rothe_02: An older Rothe. Focusing on eating before he is called to work.
session_synopses.Mutineers_FollowUp: The mutinous duergar tells the player what comes next for them: an assault on Moonrise Towers.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.context: NodeContext: Said with great relief, but tinged with anger

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.text: Worthless slaves. Your incompetence has been my ruin.
Mutiny.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the gnomesNodeContext: Intense but quietly so.

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.context: CinematicNodeContext: True Soul Nere prepares his spell, readying to attack the gnome Meerna. Nere strikes Meerna down with a magic attack, and raises his hand to strike down Beldron.NodeContext: ZHIL loo-NIN! Rising, seething anger. Only the last word should be louder.

Mutiny.speaker: Player
Mutiny.text: Stop! No more innocents will die today, Nere.

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.text: You care for the weak, True Soul. Most curious.

Mutiny.speaker: Player
Mutiny.text: This isn't about them. I just can't stand your face.

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.text: And yet you came to my aid.

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.text: A test - yes, you must be. The Absolute bade you to try Nere's faith.

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.text: Thrinn. Carve out their heart and serve it to the rothé.

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.text: If they are indeed a True Soul, let the Absolute save them.

Mutiny.speaker: Player
Mutiny.text: You wouldn't dare. I'm faithful to the Absolute.

session_synopses.Mindmeld_LeavingRegion: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.
session_synopses.Mutiny: Dialogue after you destroy the cave-in and set Nere free. Thrinn has been put in charge of getting Nere out, but it's the player who accomplishes it. Nere almost just died from inhaling poisonous gas, so he's very angry. In this dialogue, you determine the fate of the gnomes as well as Nere and the mutinous duergar.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Tell Laridda I'm dead. It's the best way.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: He hid from the Hells' forces - but they still got to him.

session_synopses.HiddenGnome: Philomeen is ready to die for her cause. She has run from the duergar with explosives and when the player arrives, she assumes they are a true soul and would sooner blow herself up than let the player take her to Moonrise.If you reach the end of her dialogue, she'll leave once you get far enough away.
session_synopses.PAD: Players find the journal in the Panic Room after identifying the Merregon Masks. This belonged to a Dark Justiciar who hid from the orthon when it rampaged, and was trapped when rubble fell.

node_data.speaker: Mossy Myconid
node_data.text: ((*no peace*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Alchemist Argram
node_data.text: You tryin' to tip us over? Stop moving, idiot.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Jerris
node_data.text: One wrong move, and you're goin' in the lake.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
node_data.text: You ain't clan - you got no business here.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.NodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard. He is seated with the duergar elder most of the time.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Incredible. Every rock, every jewel tells a story.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The most interesting secrets are alway lurking just under the surface.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can talk to Stonemason Kith to obtain some info on the city. The following VB is a reaction to the knowledge acquired in that dialog. For specifics, see UND_DuergarRebelMason_01.This will be anchored on the character who left the dialog but this is mostly reacting to an info dump, so all characters can be opinionated.

03.speaker: Thudd
03.text: Good riddance. Hoon caused nothing but trouble.

session_synopses.03: Pissed off duergar raider who is standing guard while the gnomes are digging up a collapsed tunnel. He is cursing his superior, saying they should just let him suffocate. The player can make use of this and threathen the duergar, saying they will tell the sergeant unless the duergar gives them money.

session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_02: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.
session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_03: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.
session_synopses.AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is taking his turn.

Spider04.speaker: Lur Fu
Spider04.context: NodeContext: Quickly, rhythmically, like a chant

session_synopses.Spider03: Followup with spiders after they kill their sister Xanta.
session_synopses.Spider04: Followup dialogue with spider after they attack and kill Lur Xanta

PAD_InteractingWithOrb.speaker: Player
PAD_InteractingWithOrb.text: Something's off. Pure shadow - around me, inside me.

session_synopses.PAD_InteractingWithOrb: The character voicing feeling the presence of Shar when interacting with a Sharran artefact used to gain Darkvision.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Pull Nere from the rubble. Time Nere gets what's coming.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Any ideas on how I might do that?

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Some days back, a slave gnome bolted with smokepowder. Handy stuff.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Bet her crew know more than they're letting on - see if you can get 'em to talk.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Once Nere's out, we'll pound him to powder and take our dues.

session_synopses: Leader of the Merceneries-to-be-mutineers. An elder mind-master with psionic sensitivity. You can follow up with him about the quest he gave you earlier.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Curious - what are those marks there?

SurvivalCheck_PAD.speaker: Player
SurvivalCheck_PAD.text: Bloodied tracks - quite small, too. A gnome found some trouble here.

session_synopses.PAD: The player spots a sign of Thulla's escape: footprints. Player wishes to take a closer look.
session_synopses.SurvivalCheck_PAD: The player identifies Thulla's tracks to be that of an escaping gnome if they pass a survival check

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Curious - that stone there's been pried loose.

session_synopses.PAD: The player notices a loose stone in the Duergar Camp.There is a hidden stash underneath.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The rock under your feet juts upwards, forming a perfectly engraved tombstone with a small epitaph.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: This is a duplicate of node N15

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You realise it was made with Stone Shape - a powerful spell to waste on a grave.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text:
*In memory of Myrna - a shining light in this dark world.
May you forever gaze upon the lake you loved to play in.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: Tombstone on the grave at Sussur Tree. Digging the grave unveils a collar of a pet (cat or dog). The pet was of cleric of Mystra who lived in the Arcane Tower nearby. This collar has no use on the first sight, at least there's no magical properties. But the secret is it allowed cleric's pet to have food or navigate inside the tower.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: Fezzerk does the talking here. Bother him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are rotating him around for their amusement.The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using the amulet of the Conquering God as a way to convince the goblins,  if they took it from the priests in the wilderness. GnomeGobllin2 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. He doesn't have much to say; either snarling threats or grovelling to those who intimidate him (drow, in this case).

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: The House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.
Dinner.context: CinematicNodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.NodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: Go on. Partake. Enjoy your supper. After all...

session_synopses.Dinner: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.

Goblin_01.speaker: Tracker Slice
Goblin_01.text: Just scraping up some pieces, majesty. Don't mind me.

AD_Subordinates.speaker: Goblin Warrior
AD_Subordinates.text: And the others getting drunk off their choppers in camp.

AD_BossAndSubordinate.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_BossAndSubordinate.context: NodeContext: search the place, don't bother me

AD_BossAndSubordinate.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_BossAndSubordinate.text: And you got nothing to show for it but your own arse.

AD_GoblinsLooting.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_GoblinsLooting.context: NodeContext: looking for results from subordinates she perceives as being idiots

session_synopses.Goblin_01: A goblin is looting a house in Moonhaven. If interrupted, the goblin is grumpy to anyone but a drow.
session_synopses.AD_Subordinates: Frustrated goblins searching a derelict building, finding little. They're bitter they can't be getting drunk in camp with the others.
session_synopses.AD_BossAndSubordinate: Goblins scouting an abandoned village-- boss is tired of his subordinates.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinsLooting: Frustrated goblins looting an empty derelict buiilding

Village_Trespassing.text: You sent from Moonrise, drow? 'Cos otherwise, I'll have to cut ya.

session_synopses.Village_Trespassing: This guard has come upon you sneaking through a village her force is occupying. She was bored and sees you as a potential source of fun (ie, someone to murder/bully).  Defaulting to she, but numerous goblins could deliver this dialogue as it's a dynamic crime one.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You hear another muffled cry. The two inside are still in the throes of... passion.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Open the door.

node_data.speaker: Grukkoh
node_data.text: Ngh. W-what the hells are you doin'?
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: A look of surprise and facination stretches across the player's face.
Offscreen the couple notices us, the camera catches them scrambling off as quickly as possible.NodeContext: Still busy with his ogress at first, then realises someone entered.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Back away slowly.

node_data.speaker: Buthir
node_data.text: Ruined! Smash - I'll SMASH YOU!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bugbear is getting off of the ogress and glares at me, if possible, he should be a bit ruffled. The ogress is behind hin and still getting up, adjusting the clothes around her waist. it should be clear they were having sex.NodeContext: The ogress is flying into a rage.

VB_Scholar.speaker: Player
VB_Scholar.text: Yikes, don't disturb a half-ogre in the making!

session_synopses.AD_BugbearKilled: The players have killed the bugbear (the Ogress' lover) and she swears revenge.
session_synopses: The player arrives at a house and hears a strange noise inside. It might sound like a fight is happening inside, but upon closer inspection they can learn that a bugbear and an ogre are making love.
session_synopses.Ogre_Dead: Butthir the ogre has been killed - you are now speaking with her corpse.
session_synopses.VB_Scholar: Comment made after seeing the ogre and bugbear having sex AND passing a successful Nature check.

node_data.speaker: Chock
node_data.text: Friend. No eat friend.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: We're, eh, working hard for Absolute. Hope you spare a good word for us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Servile

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to windmill sail and are rotating him for their amusement. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possiblyby using their mind-influencing powers or otherwise convincing the goblins they're on the same side. GnomeGobllin3 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. She's abrupt and aggressive to most, though servile and meek if the player happens to be a drow.

003_Dead.speaker: Edowin
003_Dead.text: Edowin... a True Soul... a Chosen...

session_synopses.003_Dead: True Soul Edowin has been killed by an owlbear. This is his corpse speaking. He is concerned about his siblings and still devoted to the Absolute.

PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.speaker: Player
PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.text: A prayer sheet. What's this symbol on it?

PAD_TriggeredTrap.speaker: Player
PAD_TriggeredTrap.text: Agh! This thing won't yield its contents easily...
PAD_TriggeredTrap.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a moderate jolt of pain.

PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.speaker: Player
PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.text: Chest's unlocked. My prayers are answered.
PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a prayer unlocking a magically sealed chest.

session_synopses.PAD_PickupPrayerSheet: The player comments after picking up an old prayer sheet. They may or may not recognise that it could help them unlock a magically sealed chest.
session_synopses.PAD_TriggeredTrap: The player reacts to a magically-locked chest injuring them upon attempting to open it without disabling the protections.
session_synopses.PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer: The player passes comment after they manage to open a magically sealed chest by reciting a prayer they found. If Shadowheart or a worshipper of Shar is speaking, the prayer does nothing.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A wine bottle? A scholar with good taste, perhaps.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Or maybe a bit of a drinking problem.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for FOR. The player finds a book hiding a secret bottle of wine.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Mm. Temptation knocks.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I notice you don't bear a brand of your own.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: I've no use for the Absolute - or any god. I follow two masters only: gluttony and greed.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: The goblins understand my appetites. They sate my hunger for gold...

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: ...and the rest sate my hunger for meat.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: I simply look for marks. Gold is more than sufficient compensation.

session_synopses: Loomp is the smart ogre. he checks for your mark since he is working for the goblin boss. You can convince him (and his fellow ogres, if they are there) to join you in battle. He should sound intelligent and HUNGRY.

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *The well stands, as it has for ages.*

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Apart from an overgrowth of moss, the well looks unremarkable.*

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Dry stones line the wall, but the darkness below is impenetrable.*

AD_EttercapDisturbanceWarning.context: NodeContext: A bit like a spider chirp, but a bit louder, if possible.

session_synopses.InteractWithWell: Dialogue when first interacting with the well.
session_synopses.AD_EttercapDisturbanceWarning: The ettercap feels that someone stepped on its web and lets out a warning screech.
session_synopses.VB_EnterNest: The player sees the gigantic spider in the spider nest.

AD_Plead.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: mocking barcus as he (barcus) flies on the windmill pane.

AD_Plead.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Plead.context: NodeContext: Calling down to a goblin who has him captive on the windmill. Said while spinning on windmill.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Urrrgh... magga cammara - those pustulent thugs!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/actor context - the deep gnome sways dizzilyNodeContext: 'Magga cammara' pronounced 'Mag-ah cam-ah-rah'. Gnomish exclamation meaning 'by the stones'.
Barcus the deep gnome is suffering some grogginess after spinning on the sail of a windmill for the last while.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well - get on with it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of sorts after his ordeal spinning on a windmill, now a mixture of resigned and annoyed. He's expecting you to extort him now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Get on with what?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: You saved me. Now you'll extort me. That's how this works, yes?
node_data.context: NodeContext: impatient

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You owe me nothing.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'd rather know how you got caught.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: My own fault, really. I should have dropped my pack and outrun those bastards. Alas.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Take my pack if you can find it. The only reason those goblins caught me was its weight. I'll travel lightly from now on.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Has not offered pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

SpeedUp.speaker: Narrator
SpeedUp.text: NodeContext: Intentionally blank for cinematic purposes
SpeedUp.context: NodeContext: Intentionally blank for cinematic purposes

SpeedUp.text: CinematicNodeContext: Unfortunate Gnome gets flung off.
SpeedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unfortunate Gnome gets flung off.

AD_UnfortunateGnomePikeFail.speaker: Player
AD_UnfortunateGnomePikeFail.context: NodeContext: The player mutters to themselves as they struggle to untie a bound hostage in need of aid.

session_synopses.AD_Plead: Fezzerk the goblin calls up to his captive, Barcus Wroot, who is being spun on the blade of a windmill, mocking his efforts to attract help.
session_synopses: The player speaks to a deep gnome after freeing him from some goblins, who'd had him tied to the sail of a windmill. The player discovers that the deep gnome travelled to the region as he learned his old friend is in danger. By way of thanks, he provides the player with the means to craft smokepowder, an explosive item. He then leaves for the Underdark in search of his friend. There, the player may encounter him again.
session_synopses.SpeedUp: Narration - the player senses the windmill's rotation is speeding up after a brake is released.
session_synopses.AD: If the player gets the windmill to stop spinning, then clicks Barcus, Barcus will get these lines. Barcus will be impatient, mistrustful of the player, but still in need of player's help.
session_synopses.AD_RotatingFasterReaction: Said while being spun faster on the pane of a windmill. Should be in a panic.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomePikeFail: Player failed to untie Barcus from the windmill.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're a True Soul. You can't die. Please stay with us.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The true soul is dying, laying on the ground, injured.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: I don't think he's conscious. Can you hear us, Ed?
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brynna turns toward the player.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: An owlbear. Please, do you have any -

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Shut up, Andrick! Do you serve the Absolute?

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *The injured man locks eyes with you. A familiar squirming churns in your head.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Move away, reaching for your weapon.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *Your limbs do not obey. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: They are a True Soul. Mind them. They will - they - they...
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.NodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cultists pause for an extra moment here before continuing the dialogue, to properly acknowledge the true soul's passing.NodeContext: Sad, mourning air

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're... you're a True Soul. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Still sad from brother dying. Trying to be strong.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Do you have orders for us? We were reporting to Edowin.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Hopeful for guidance, sad remembering her brother. We WERE reporting to Edowin, but... he just died.

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: You're mistaken - I'm no True Soul.

AD_AtCaveEntrance.speaker: Andrick
AD_AtCaveEntrance.text: Bloody Ed. I wish he'd listened.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Heartbroken. Her other brother died in the owlbear fight. Trying to hold it together.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: He's... with Edowin now, right? He's with the Absolute.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Player
Cultist002_InCave.text: Perhaps. Who truly knows the ways of our god?

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: I suppose... I suppose the Absolute keeps some mysteries from us all.
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Trying very hard not to cry.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: What would you have of me now, True Soul?
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Trying to rally. Trying to be brave.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Player
Cultist002_InCave.text: Find the nearest stronghold and report on your mission.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: Edowin told us there was a camp of faithful goblins nearby. It'll do me good to be among allies.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Saying goodbye to the player. She means it.

session_synopses.Cultists: The party encounters two novices of the Absolute , attending to a True Soul who had been leading them through the region. He now lies injured, but recognises us as having been tadpoled. He tells his novices that we are trustworthy, but they aren't so sure. We can convince them to do as we order, and tell them to leave the area or else set out to find the creature that attacked their True Soul leader.
session_synopses.AD_AtCaveEntrance: Two junior members of a cult have been sent to hunt the wild creature that killed their superior. They've found its nest, but are reluctant to proceed inside and face the beast.
session_synopses.Cultist002_InCave: Novice Brynna. a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, has been sent by hersupposed superior to attack an owlbear - a wild creature that killed another cultist. She reacts to the monster's presence before attacking it, then seeks orders from the player once it is dead.

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.context: NodeContext: Exclamation during combat, ordering lackeys

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: I've got the plans and the sussur bark. Now I need somewhere to craft it all.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: The forge at the blacksmith's house should do.

VB_TakeJournal.speaker: Player
VB_TakeJournal.text: Interesting. I wonder if those blueprints survived.

VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.speaker: Player
VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.text: What in the hells was that?

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *A candy-sweet scent wafts forth: the sussur bark infuses the weapon from within the flames.*

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *The flames sputter away. The sword is complete.*

PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.speaker: Player
PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.text: If only I knew where to find some.

session_synopses.VB_TakeSussurSap: Voice bark: player takes sussur sap from a tree. SUSS-er. Needed to make a special weapon.
session_synopses.VB_TakeJournal: The players read a journal from an apprentice smith who wrote about how he'd designed a powerful weapon.
session_synopses.VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear: Player sees a phase spider slip in and out of reality.Probably not clear exactly what it was.
session_synopses.ForgeWeapon: The player has all the ingredients and fires up the furnace to make their masterwork.This is all narration; narration needed as most of this scene will likely not be visually communicative.
session_synopses.PAD_NatureCheckOutcome: Player is commenting on a rare ingredient needed for crafting a powerful weapon. Sussur bark can only be found in the Underdark.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A feast fit for an ogre. You notice a peculiar dagger protruding from the tough, leathery meat.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger still juts from the meat.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grasp the handle and pull the dagger with all your might.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You yank the dagger free, leaving a narrow slit behind.*

session_synopses: Near a forest village, there are remains of an ogre campfire and meat spit over it. There's a cool dagger stuck in the meat. The player can attempt to retrieve it in a few ways (2 are listed here, but feel free to add another branch).

PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.text: Oi! You fightin' them ogres, then you fightin' with me!

session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight: Goblin near the ogres joins the fight if player gets into combat with them.

LastCub.speaker: Narrator
LastCub.text: *The cub looks from you to his dead mother.*
LastCub.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cub looks from dead mother to the player, wailing.NodeContext: Narrator node!

PAD_KilledByGoblins.speaker: Player
PAD_KilledByGoblins.text: Looks like the goblins found her.

VB_EnterCave.speaker: Player
VB_EnterCave.text: That stench... dead owlbear prey, no doubt.
VB_EnterCave.context: NodeContext: Upon entering the den of a carnivorous beast. Rotting, half-eaten prey are strewn about. The player previously identified the beast as an owlbear.

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: At least the cub has a fighting chance now.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning; justifying decision to let an orphaned animal cub live.

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: That, or we've just prolonged its misery.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Unconvinced. Wondering if it would've been better to kill the animal.

CMB_Enrage.speaker: Owlbear
CMB_Enrage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Charges to attack.NodeContext: Horrified and enraged

VB_LastCub.speaker: Player
VB_LastCub.text: A lone cub isn't much of a threat...

VB_LastCub.speaker: Player
VB_LastCub.text: Not without its mother by its side. What now?

session_synopses.LastCub: In SwA, this cub speaks in short bursts - he sounds staccato, vicious.The player has killed an owlbear - a large, predatory wild animal. The owlbear's cub remains however, and lingers by his dead mother. The player can decide whether to put the cub out of its misery, or else leave it. If the player has the speak with animals skill, they get some additional insight into the cub's anxiety. If the player lets the cub live, it will proceed to eat its mother - it's still a wild animal, after all.
session_synopses.PAD_KilledByGoblins: a Voicebark to make it more clear that a band of goblins came and killed the owlbear after the players have seen the owlbear but left the cave with her alive.
session_synopses.VB_EnterCave: The player enters a cave that houses an owlbear - a large, aggressive wild beast. They might comment on the stench of half-eaten prey, or note that some tracks they discovered lead into the cave.
session_synopses.VB_CubResolution_2P: The party briefly reflects on their decision to spare or kill an orphaned owlbear cub.
session_synopses.CMB_Enrage: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - in this dialogue specifically, she is enraged.Players encounter an owlbear mother and her cub in a cave. This dialogue plays if players smash her egg or kill her cub in front of her.
session_synopses.VB_LastCub: After killing an adult owlbear, combat ends as the player notes that the surviving owlbear cub doesn't pose much of a threat to them.

PAD_SeluniteNecklace.speaker: Player
PAD_SeluniteNecklace.context: NodeContext: Upon seeing a Selunite necklace

session_synopses.PAD_SeluniteNecklace: Reflection on the Selunite necklace found in the abandoned village.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: Stop! I give up! M-mercy, please!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: NodeContext: Desperate, grovelling. He's throwing in the towel as he's on the verge of losing a fight.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: I know things. If you let me live, I'll make it worth your while. I p-promise!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: InternalNodeContext: Non-barbarian flowNodeContext: Scared, bargaining for this life.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Player
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: Talk and you might live. If it's worth my while.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: M-my lot are camped nearby - I can get you inside, no hassle! You can loot it, do whatever!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: NodeContext: Nervous. Spilling the beans. His life likely depends on whether the player finds this info useful.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: There's a hidden path, p-past the bridge into the camp. Over to the side before you reach the first guards. Easy.
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: NodeContext: Nervous. Spilling the beans. His life likely depends on whether the player finds this info useful.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: What've we got 'ere...? Oh.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin's face falls mid-sentence when he realises he's being confronted by a drow.NodeContext: The goblin loses his bluster mid sentence upon realising he's facing a feared drow

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Stop this thiiiing!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: A captive deep gnome swings past on the sail of a spinning windmill. Though he's in peril, this is basically being played as a comedic beat.NodeContext: Distressed. The deep gnome is tied to the sail of a windmill and desperately calls for help as he rotates. He's a short-moderate distance away and has to shout to be heard.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The goblin seems unsure whether to bow to you or attack.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: Narration.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: W-what do you want, or, I mean... what do you need?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nervous, fumbling over his words. He's naturally afraid of drows such as the player.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack the goblins.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: W-wha? Quick, get 'em!
