session_synopses.Surrender_NotAtWindmill: After being defeated in combat, a goblin named Fezzerk begs for mercy from the player. He tries to bargain for his life. The player can let him go or kill him. This dialogue takes place somewhere away from the windmill where Fezzerk was tormenting Barcus Wroot.
session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are watching him spin around. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using a cult symbol of authority as a way to convince the goblins, if they have it. FOR_GnomeGoblin_1 (Fezzerk) is the leader of the goblins and does most of the talking. If the player is a drow, the goblins will be much more nervous and easier to intimidate. At times, the captive goblin pipes up from the windmill, loudly pleading or berating his captors.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Send them to the dirt!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Preparing for battle - and excited for it.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: Wha', fun's over? All right then...

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid). Delivery should be vicious and mean-spirited - they're torturing a helpless gnome for sport.
session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin reacts to the decision to leave with slight disappointment.

AD_DoorMarks.speaker: Narrator
AD_DoorMarks.text: *Names and heights have been carved into the wood over the years. The last two read 'Maggie Terrens' and 'Marcus Terrens'. Twins, perhaps.*

session_synopses.AD_DoorMarks: Markings on a door frame in an abandoned schoolhouse showing chidlren's growth over the years.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
node_data.text: What do ya want? I'm not the one in charge.

session_synopses: A goblin raider, part of a patrol roaming the forest. Currently tormenting a deep gnome prisoner by tying him to a windmill. If the player gets too close, the goblin turns hostile - unless the player is a drow, in which case the goblin is servile.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: Lapis root? Saffa? Rare to see these so far north.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: A shame they've wilted, these must have cost a fortune.

VB_Bookcase.speaker: Player
VB_Bookcase.text: Hmm. Scratch marks on the floor...
VB_Bookcase.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. Noticed a potential clue in an abandoned house.

VB_ReadLedger.speaker: Player
VB_ReadLedger.text: It says there's a cellar here somewhere.

session_synopses.VB_InspectHerbs: The player examines some long-dead herbs in an abandoned house. They may notice the herbs themselves are unusual and exotic - not what you'd typically expect to be cultivated in a small-town apothecary.
session_synopses.VB_Bookcase: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player discovers a clue that leads to the wizard's secret lab.
session_synopses.VB_ReadLedger: The player comments that a ledger they just read suggests the existence of a cellar; one they haven't found yet.

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: They spoke of the Absolute - same as that goblin, Sazza. Curious.

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: Seems as though the Absolute's attracting followers from all kinds of places.

session_synopses.VB_DiscoverPriests: Player spots the wounded True Soul and his minions, is wary about what's going on.
session_synopses.PAD_PostScene: An automated dialog by players, triggered after the scene with the Absolute Cultists in which the True Soul dies is over. The party wonders aloud what the cultists were talking about when they mentioned 'true souls' and 'the Absolute'. They may have a little more context if they already spoke to Sazza, a captured cultist goblin

PAD_NotReturning.speaker: Player
PAD_NotReturning.text: You can't summon a dead ogre, it turns out.

session_synopses.PAD_NotReturning: Player Blows ogre horn, but no one comes.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Git over there. Surround 'em, like.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing to the other goblinsNodeContext: In a loud whisper

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I know you're there. Show yourselves.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: You spotted us. Good. 'S like they say...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands on hips, cockyNodeContext: Covering up their surprise

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: No fun in skewerin' a pig what doesn't know he's cooked.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A threat

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I don't want any trouble.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: An' I didn't want to be stuck moppin' up nosy trespassers like you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: The goblin is annoyed to be stuck on guard duty

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Ain't no one gettin' their way today.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Or you turn around, an' your backside gets the same treatment.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: This ought to be fun. Lads!
node_data.context: NodeContext: A rally call to attack.

Warning.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
Warning.text: More of our crowd inside, but we'll send word you're all right.
Warning.context: NodeContext: We've been let past a checkpoint, she's reassuring us we won't be attacked.

CheckpointGuardsWarning.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
CheckpointGuardsWarning.context: NodeContext: We caught him idling at the entrance of a checkpoint. Not trying very hard with the lie.

AD_StartedCombat.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_StartedCombat.text: You must got a death wish, sneakin' around in my town.

session_synopses.PAD_SpottedAmbush: This PAD plays if players pass a successful Perception check when entering an abandoned village. Goblins are sneaking around in the village, setting up an ambush.
session_synopses: This dialogue triggers when players enter a village being guarded by goblins. The goblins are on rooftops - the player may either be on the ground or on the rooftops with them (if they've snuck in). If the player has passed a perception check beforehand, the dialogue starts while the goblins are still getting into place for an ambush. Otherwise, the goblins are already in place, surrounding the player.If the player is not a drow, the goblins will attack the player at the end of the dialogue unless players can talk them out of it.
session_synopses.Warning: Goblin warrior standing guard in the abandoned village - she's eager for a fight and slightly let down if we talk our way past.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuardsWarning: Backup guard protecting the entrance to a village the goblins have seized

session_synopses.PAD_PlayerHeardEttercapWarning: The player has touched a spider web and heard an ettercap scream in response. They realise the ettercap has found out they are there.

VB_OwlBearPrints.speaker: Player
VB_OwlBearPrints.text: Looks like a beast came through here - a big one too.
VB_OwlBearPrints.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Spoken in reference to a large set of animal tracks they've spotted.

session_synopses.VB_OwlBearPrints: The player discovers a large set of animal tracks. They may be able to identify them as those of an owlbear.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The book radiates power, but the words you read in the Codex echo in your mind, guiding your eyes safely across the page.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The once-indecipherable glyphs now feel dangerously familiar, promising unholy power to those who can take it.*

Tome.speaker: Player
Tome.text: Read on and wrest the book's power from it.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *As you parse the strange glyphs, you can feel the book resisting. Ghostly voices whisper at you from the dark - probing and fighting your mind.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *But your will is iron and you brush past these shades of the past, devouring every secret the book has to offer.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *You see now, life and death are malleable as clay, to be bent and reshaped by your will. By your power.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *But as you close the book, a nagging doubt whispers in your mind. What consequences will there be for calling the dead from their rest?*

session_synopses.PAD_FindBook: PAD when you pick up 'The Necromancy of Thay' (DangerousBook_Tome.lsj). Character might have a sense that the book is evil or just be curious about what it might contain.
session_synopses.Tome: The player finds a book on necromancy - from one of the Red Wizards of Thay. Once read, the book will be bound to whoever tried to read it. Some origins will demand you let them read it, while others will want the book burned. If you read the book, you'll hear strange, distant whispers. The more you read, the stronger the voices will become, and the greater the chance that you'll be driven mad.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Huh. Haven't seen that game in years.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Little sing-song to the tune of 'one, two, buckle my shoe'

session_synopses.PAD: A faded children's game marked on the floor - tic-tac-toe or hopscotch, maybe. Different races remark may or may not recall the game from their youth. Planar or gith might not recognize it - assume it's code.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: C'mon, blood-breath. Let's find you something to eat.
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a worg companion, urging it to come along.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Worg
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Worgs are vicious beasts but have a little more sentience than most animals, and are capable of rudimentary speech.

session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin beckons to a worg - time to head off.

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog sniffs his owner's corpse

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Snarling, turning to the player

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.text: What are you doing? Get back!

session_synopses.Dog:
In SwA, Scratch speaks like a human. He doesn't have any kind of dog-like affectation, nor is he stupid - he's well-spoken, even when he's saying 'dog' things. Throughout the dialogue, he's stoic but heartbroken, deluding himself into believing that his master is not dead.We come across the corpse of a man being protected by his loyal dog, Scratch.The dog refuses to let us near the dead man or his belongings, forcing us to try and win him over (or else just kill him). We can use Speak with Animals to get further insight into the dog's perspective.
 If we cast Speak with Dead upon the courier, we can learn the dog's name and use this as an additional way to win it over.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: No talk, only bite! Go to goblin leader for talk.

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

AD_HagCackles.context: NodeContext: A set of different cackles for Ethel. All evil. All nasty. All mean. At least three different kinds.

AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor.text: 'A thief who tried to steal from Auntie. Now the good little pet guards my home.'

AD_VictimSign_004.text: 'My sweet Calim, whose beloved asked that his beauty never fade.'

PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.speaker: Player
PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.text: They're not attacking. Must think I'm one of them.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Ungh... what... argh... what in the bloody hells is going on?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: I - I remember that bit. I think. She...  turned me to stone. Because of the Bite! Of course.
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Your memories are coming back. You remember going to the hag for a spell to save you.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: I can't believe you fixed it. How did you cure me?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: . You have an incurable disease and you can't believe they player managed to fix it (spoiler: they didn't)

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Well - yes. Why d'ya bloody think I'm here?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Player has asked about your disease and was it contagious. You're surprised and confused by the question.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Oh, no, no. Why - why did you remove the spell if ya couldn't fix me?!
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. You realise the player hasn't cured you of a horrible and contagious disease you have - they've condemned you to death.

AD_VictimSign_005.text: 'This poor dear wished never to lay eyes on her family again.'

VB_BurningCage.speaker: Player
VB_BurningCage.context: NodeContext: You're trying to save a woman. She's trapped in a cage that is one fire.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.text: Hah! Catch me if you can, petal!
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.context: NodeContext: You've turned invisible and disappeared during the fight. Laughing and joking with amused menace.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You feel crushing waves of fear as a presence within the door recoils. It can't let people through. Not again!*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just a shot of the player and the door - no visions yet. Player pressing a hand to their head as waves of fear hit them.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You see the gallery, its walls lined with the hag's victims - their bodies and minds twisted beyond ruin.*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the gallery - the huddled victim in the mirror, the headless victim, the vacant bleeding eyes sockets

AD_VictimSign_002.text: 'My darling Magron. She wished for the mind of a genius, but the silly head crossed me.'

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.text: Get me out of this hellhole!
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.context: NodeContext: The hag has sent out illusions that look like you. You're horrified and crying out to the player, running towards them for safety. It's in the middle of a fight and you're scared but still being your usual bratty and petulant self.

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Dead.text: Do you regret making a deal with the hag?

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead.text: Making a... deal? Yes. Being... here...? No.

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead.text: Here... I couldn't see it... couldn't see... my family... dead and rotten.

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake.context: NodeContext: This is the fake illusion. She has Mayrina's voice and is pretending to be Mayrina. Crying in the fight - begging and pleading for the player to believe that they are the real Mayrina and the other is the fake. It should ring a little false.

AD_SummonVictims.context: NodeContext: You're forcing two people to come help you in battle - it's a spell and they have no free will. Soft alluring voice as you call our to them across the room.

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_005_Dead.text: Why did you go to the hag?

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead.text: My family took her... my baby girl...

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead.text: Told Ethel... never wanted... to see them again... she... took my eyes...

VB_MayrinaInCage.speaker: Player
VB_MayrinaInCage.context: NodeContext: You've spotted the woman you're trying to save.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I was a fool. I wanted to know my fate. I had a choice between two lives, and I was frightened of choosing wrong.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Player has asked how you ended up in the hag lair. Your voice is filled with regret.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I asked the hag to help me see what the future would hold. Got what I wished for, too.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I saw my future self - a corpse, rotten with maggots. And everyone around me dead. Putrid and dead.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Dazed horror as you recall the visions that pushed you to the brink of insanity.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed.text: You mentioned choosing between two lives. What were they?

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: A boring story. Stay or go. Marriage and kids or a life of novelty.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Your voice is filled with regret. You gave up everything because you were too afarid to make a choice.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I lost my best years rather than just... choose.

AD_VictimSign_003.text: 'My gentle Lorin. He wished to know what was to come.'

AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.context: NodeContext: Calling out from a cage. You're scared but determined - yelling for the fighting to stop

Victim_004.speaker: Narrator
Victim_004.text: *The mirror glints in the light - the screams from within now silent.*

VB_MirrorScreams.speaker: Player
VB_MirrorScreams.context: NodeContext: Confused at the sound but you can't tell where it is.

PutOnMask.text: Hello, petal. My, my - the mask suits you. Just relax. See the world with fresh eyes.
And let your dear old Auntie Ethel look after you.

AD_VictimSign_001.text: 'My dearest Efrin. He begged me to halt the deadly disease that ravaged him.'

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1.context: NodeContext: You've summoned illusions of yourself to confuse and taunt the player. You're calling out to them in a mocking and amused tone.

AD_ViciousMockery.text: Think you're a person because you're walking on two feet? Adorable.

AD_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
AD_Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: One the ground - cowering. Curled up - looking in front of you at a mirror and then ducking behind your hands. NodeContext: Panicked and afraid. You're severely traumatised and not really aware of your surroundings.

AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.speaker: Demir, Johl
AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of a fight. The hag has assumed the form of your sister but you can tell it's fake. Calling out a warning to the player - fear in your voice.

EntranceDouble.text: You are as thick as they come, sweetness.
EntranceDouble.context: NodeContext: Threatening smile while taunting player.The old lady act is gone.

VB_EnteredGallery.speaker: Player
VB_EnteredGallery.context:
NodeContext: Creeped out and horrified as you enter a 'gallery' of the hag's victims.
Shadowheart: droll.

PAD_AtEntrance.speaker: Player
PAD_AtEntrance.context: NodeContext: Wyll's line: a bit sing-songy but not too much.

AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of the fight - the player has figured out which illusion is the real you and hit you. You're PISSED. Furious at the player, yelping in pain for one of them, and roaring at the player for the others. Furious, vengeful and MAD.

ControlledByMask.text: Stay with me, petal. Stay with Auntie. Forever.

Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.speaker: Player
Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.text: A mind flayer. No intention of letting that happen.

AD_DoubleDied.context: NodeContext: You have created illusions of yourself. The player is attacking you - but getting the illusion instead. You're laughing and taunting them - rubbing it in their face that they can't find you.

session_synopses.AD_HagCackles: A set of different cackles for Ethel to be used in the lair.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore1: Players have wandered into the Hag Lair without Ethel being present and are commenting on the creepy environment. This is the first to fire.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor: This person has been turned into a door and is unable to speak. Sign attached to it.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_004: This person is trapped in a mirror and mute.
session_synopses.PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral: You are wearing the mask and the other masked victims do not attack you.
session_synopses.Victim_001:
The dwarf was turned to stone by the hag to stop the spread of an deadly disease - Laduguer's Bite. Little does he know that the hag was the one who cause the disease in the first place.

Should you remove the petrification spell BEFORE the hag is dead, the disease will kill him.

Should you speak to him after the hag is dead, you can figure out that the hag is the one who made him sick in the first place.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_005: An eyeless woman - dead. One of the hag's victims. You're reading a sign in front of her eyeless body.
session_synopses.VB_BurningCage: This occurs when the hag sets the cage on fire.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2: The hag turns invisible and disappears during the fight.
session_synopses.TalkingDoor: The door guarding the entrance to the hag's lair. It's actually transparent and the player can walk through it. It's a cut scene as the door tries to project images onto the player and communicate to them. Pleading with them to leave. The door was a thief that was taken by Ethel and torn to shreds, with the remainder of his body transformed into a door.Much of this is a 'cut scene' as the door projects visions into the player's mind instead of communicating.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_002: A victim holding their own decapitated head in their hands. This is the sign attached to their corpse.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real: Triggered during the fight with the hag. She has sent out illusions mimicking Mayrina. The real Mayrina is trying running towards the player. Her voice and mannerisms should be a clue to the player that this is the real Mayrina.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Dead: The characters has died and player is using the 'speak with dead' spell. Character is at peace. He lived in fear of his own death. Now that it's happened, he's at peace.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake: These are fired during the fight. It's the hag pretending to be Mayrina.
session_synopses.AD_SummonVictims: Auntie Ethel summons victim_001 and victime_003 to aide her in battle.
session_synopses.Victim_005_Dead: A dialogue with the corpse of a hag victim with her eyes gouged out. She is happy to be dead-- she lived a terrible life and carried family secrets heavily upon her. Her voice should be meek and delicate. She has borne too much in this life already and is ready to be done.
session_synopses.VB_MayrinaInCage: Triggers when the player enters the lair and sees Mayrina trapped in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Freed: This occurs if Lorin survived the fight with the hag. He is dazed and out of it. This is the victim who first say the player as a mind flayer and freaked out. 1) In scenario one, he was never summoned by the hag2) He was summoned and attacked the player and saw the player turn into a mindflayer3) He was summoned and attacked the player but never saw the player as a mind flayer
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_003: This person is alive but severely traumatised and hysterical.
session_synopses.AD_SurrogateMotherInCage: ADs fire by Mayrina when she is trapped in the cage. In the first set it's when combat has started and she is cheering the player on, in the second set she just wants the player to leave her alone. In the third set the cage is on fire, and in the last the fighting is over but she's still locked in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_004: A victim of the hag's. They're trapped inside a mirror.
session_synopses.VB_MirrorScreams: Trigger near mirror - someone is trapped inside.
session_synopses.PutOnMask: Player put on mask and is hearing auntie's voice telepathically booming around them.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_001: This is the plaque that is attached to the petrified body of one of the hag's victims.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1: The fires as Ethel summons illusions of herself to confuse the player.
session_synopses.AD_ViciousMockery: The Hag will cast Vicious Mockery on the party in combat. Whoever she targets will be insulted by origin or race. If a character is targeted multiple times, another insult in the chain will be used.
session_synopses.AD_Victim_003: This is a victim of the hag. He was cursed to see the future - he's severely traumatised. In the first AD he's been summoned to fight by the hag. In the rest, he's curled up ont he ground and talking to himself. Severely traumatised.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion: The hag assumes the form of Mayrina in the boss fight. The brothers are able to tell who is Mayrina and who is the hag.
session_synopses.EntranceDouble: This fires when the player enters the victim gallery, She appears to taunt them and then vanishes.
session_synopses.VB_EnteredGallery: Triggers as you enter the hag gallery. It's creepy.
session_synopses.PAD_AtEntrance: Combat has started with the hag. She's fled downstairs. You've gone through the fireplace and have just appeared in her lair. Furtive. Looking around for Auntie Ethel.
session_synopses.AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed: This fires during the fight with the player. The player has figured out which illusion is the real hag and hit it.
session_synopses.ControlledByMask: Hag mode. Player has failed a wisdom save while wearing the mask and the hag has taken over their mind. Cruel and triumphant. The other origin characters realise what has happened.
session_synopses.Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer: This occurs after speaking to the prescient victim in the hag's lair, who sees the player turn into a mind flayer in a vision.
session_synopses.AD_DoubleDied: This fires during the fight with the hag. She's created doubles of herself and the player has attacked the double - missing her. She's taunting them.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Blood everywhere. This camp was ambushed.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: No ordinary creature did this. Redcaps ripped the place to pieces.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for HAG. The player comes across a wrecked campsite that is covered in blood and clearly abandoned. Passing a Nature check reveals the culprits to be redcaps.

HagLair_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
HagLair_Victim_003.context: NodeContext: *With a gasp, the corpse shuddered.*

AD_ControlledByMask.speaker: Player
AD_ControlledByMask.text: Get out. GET OUT OF MY HEAD!
AD_ControlledByMask.context: CinematicNodeContext: Clutching head NodeContext: Panicked and afraid as the hag invades your mind. Lae'zel's line; Pa'vrylk = Stop! Pronounced; PAH-vrill-ck

AD_ControlledByMask.text: Quiet, little one. Auntie will make it all better.
AD_ControlledByMask.context: NodeContext: Soothing and cruel. A vicious insult as you take over their mind.

Lair.text: You come to my home, interfere in my business, and now have the gall to face me in the heart of my lair? You petulant bollocks.
Lair.context: NodeContext: This begins the fight. Roaring it at the player - likely on the other side of the lair. They've freed your captive and you are furious and out of blood. Fit to kill everyone in the room.

Lair.text: I'll rip your spine out your arsehole.
I'll use your blood to spice my stew.
I'll keep you alive until I've sucked the marrow from your bones.
And then I'll bring you back and do it all over again.

Lair.speaker: Mayrina
Lair.text: Just get out of here! Please!
Lair.context: NodeContext: You're in a cage suspended above a height. You're screaming at the player to get out of here. You're scared but determined.

MaskedVictim1_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, resisting a telepathic command from the hag

MaskedVictim4.speaker: Mask of Terror
MaskedVictim4.context: NodeContext: as if drugged - hushed voice

MaskedVictim4.speaker: Mask of Terror
MaskedVictim4.text: Very droll, my friend. Most amusing.
MaskedVictim4.context: NodeContext:  a deranged but poltie butler

MaskedVictim2_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim2_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, trying to resist telepathic commands from the hag who is ordering them to kill the players in combat

MaskedVictim2.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim2.text: Why is Auntie so quiet? I'm scared.

MaskedVictim2.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim2.text: Don't be afraid. I'm here to help - I need to remove the mask.

MaskedVictim2.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim2.text: There is no mask - leave me alone!
MaskedVictim2.context: NodeContext: confused and frightened, shouting in terror on last phrase - close to a panic attack

MaskedVictim4_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Terror
MaskedVictim4_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, trying to resist telepathic commands from the hag who is ordering them to kill the players in combat

MaskedVictim3.speaker: Mask of Vengeance
MaskedVictim3.text: Somebody hurt Auntie - I'll open their veins.
MaskedVictim3.context: NodeContext: confused - mind almost completely lost - 'hurt' is past tense (ie 'somebody has hurt auntie')

MaskedVictim3.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim3.text: That mask is warping your mind - I need to remove it.

MaskedVictim3.speaker: Mask of Vengeance
MaskedVictim3.text: You can't take Auntie's gift! I won't let you!

AD_PutOnMask.speaker: Player
AD_PutOnMask.context: NodeContext: Intrigued as you look around

AD_PutOnMask.text: Hello, petal. Just relax. Let me in.

MaskedVictim3_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Vengeance
MaskedVictim3_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, trying to resist telepathic commands from the hag who is ordering them to kill the players in combat

AD_WearMask.text: Stop fighting me, petal. Let me take care of you.
AD_WearMask.context: NodeContext: You are attempting to break into someone's mind and take over from afar. Voice is low and seductive - enticing.

session_synopses.AD_ControlledByMask: The player has failed the wisdom save while wearing the mask - and fallen prey to the hag's control. Auntie Ethel takes over your mind.
session_synopses.Lair: These are fired at the very beginning of the fight with the hag - tense scene. Hag is at one end of the cavern. Mayrina is trapped in a cage in the middle. Player is on the other side.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim1_AD_Resist: Lines that play in combat when the hag's masked victim resists the commands of the mask.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim4: A victim of the hag, bound into her service for so long that their mind is almost completely lost. This one is wearing the Mask of Servitude and is brainwashed to serve the hag and her 'visitors'.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim2_AD_Resist: Lines that play in combat when the hag's masked victim resists the commands of the mask.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim2: A victim of the hag, bound into her service for so long that their mind is almost completely lost. This victim is wearing the Mask of Terror, which fills them with fear of everything but the hag.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim4_AD_Resist: Lines that play in combat when the hag's masked victim resists the commands of the mask.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim3: A victim of the hag, bound into her service for so long that their mind is almost completely lost. This one is wearing the Mask of Vengeance, and is brainwashed to take revenge on anyone who hurts the hag.
session_synopses.AD_PutOnMask: Player has put on the mask and looks around - relaising they can see things different (it allows them to bypass several illusions and traps within the hag's lair). However, the hag will attempt to break into their mind.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim3_AD_Resist: Lines that play in combat when the hag's masked victim resists the commands of the mask.
session_synopses.AD_WearMask: This occurs when the player puts on the hag mask and on ever subsequent 'turn' thereafter. The player must continually succeed on a wisdom save or risk the hag taking over their mind.

session_synopses.WRLD_CleaningTable_Hag: World Behavior for Auntie Ethel wiping down tables while in Hag form

PAD_TadpoleDivine.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleDivine.text: The tadpole was tampered with? That complicates things...

PAD_TadpoleDivine.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleDivine.text: Tampered or not, we need to get these things out of our heads. Let's find another way.

session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleDivine: This VB plays after attempting to get Ethel to remove the tadpole. She confesses that there's something special about it and she can't remove it.Will play on the player who leaves the dialog that reveals this fact, but characters can be fairly opinionated here since they are reacting to knowledge.Up to two characters.

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: Bloody way to end an argument. I hope we chose the right side.

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: No point in debating what's already done. Let's go on ahead.

session_synopses.PAD_SidedHag: This VB plays after saving Ethel from the two brothers of the sister she's holding captive. Ether disappeared in a magic puff, and she was acting suspicious. The players are reacting to her exit and discussing that there may be more to Ethel than meets the eye.Speaker 1 may have been the character who was in dialog for the scene with Ethel. Speaker 2 is another party member. However, since there may be combat, this setup isn't guaranteed and it's best to write this assuming everyone had a hand in the actions that led to this VB playing.

PAD_BetrayedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_BetrayedAstarion.text: You gave him up? I wasn't sure you would.

PAD_BetrayedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_BetrayedAstarion.text: He's too dangerous to have around. We'd always be sleeping with one eye open.

session_synopses.PAD_BetrayedAstarion: PAD that plays if you decide to tell the Gur Hunter in the Swamp where to find Astarion (HAG_GurHunter.lsj).  You tell the Hunter where your camp is, the Hunter says he'll take Astarion during the night the next time you go to sleep, then the dialog ends and this PAD plays.Your companion reacts to your decision to hand Astarion over (speaker 2) and then you clarify/justify your decision (speaker 1)

Mindflayer_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer_Dead.text: *The mind flayer's corpse twitches, then collapses again. It will speak no more.*

Attack_AssaultCustom.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Attack_AssaultCustom.text: You defile the Absolute's name. Boys!

session_synopses.Mindflayer_Dead: The player casts speak with dead on the corpse of the mind flayer that tortured them at the beginning of the game.
session_synopses.Attack_AssaultCustom: Goblin king sees player commit a crime and initiates attack.

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: So yer followin' me? Think yer intimidatin' now?

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: I ain't scared. I'll claw yer eyes out if you come any closer.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's in awe. She actually wants to kiss his feet as well, but doesn't want to let it show yet.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: What was it like? Just... just curious.
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's in awe and a little jealous. She wants him to kiss her feet/to kiss his feet as well.

Friend1.speaker: Player
Friend1.text: Well, it didn't smell as bad as I thought it would - more like lavender.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: Oh, don't worry 'bout the smell. 'S that magic ring 'e wears. Some kinda stupid side effect.
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's making a side comment.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: But the foot itself, it looked craggy, didn't it? Rugged? Big? I get excited just thinkin' about it...
Friend1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin shudders, then turns to stare wistfully into space.NodeContext: excited

session_synopses.Friend1: Goblin standing next to Crusher. She's got a crush on him.
session_synopses.AtSecludedPlace: Goblin is standing on the bridge, outside the Goblin Camp.

PAD_TunnelBlocked.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelBlocked.text: Still blocked - but should be easy enough to clear.

session_synopses.PAD_TunnelBlocked: The player has pulled the body from the tunnel in the goblin prison, but it's still blocked by debris. The player can attack it if they can do enough damage (vulnrable to Force damge), are small enough to get good levrage, or shapeshifted into a badger. This AD plays to inform the player the way is still blocked and to hint at the solution.

Spiders.speaker: Narrator
Spiders.text: *The spider seems poised to attack, but she hesitates, tapping her claws as if trying to communicate.*

Spiders.speaker: Narrator
Spiders.context: CinematicNodeContext: *The other spider echoed her, tapping his claws gleefully.*

Spiders.speaker: Player
Spiders.text: Clap your hands together, mimicking her movements.

Spiders.speaker: Narrator
Spiders.text: *The spider relaxes slightly, but you feel her hunger - and fear - beneath the surface.*
CinematicNodeContext: Player gestures toward the exit
Spiders.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gestures toward the exit

Spiders.speaker: Narrator
Spiders.text: *She looks to the closed door, drooling.*

Adventurer.speaker: Smythin
Adventurer.text: Thanks. I thought I was done for.

CapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
CapturedGoblin.text: Let me go. I'll sneak off and become a hermit - won't cause trouble for nobody.
CapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: pleading; just survived an attempted execution

session_synopses.Spiders: Non-critpath. Two giant spiders trap the player. The one that shoots the web is female. Her companion is her brother.  The player has a chance to convince the spiders they are friendly, setting the spiders loose on the goblins in the camp above.
session_synopses.Adventurer: an adventurer who survived being thrown into the goblins' spider pit
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin: Sazza after she survives 'execution' the the spider pit. Pleading to the player to let her leave (which she will if she's not killed)

Goblet.speaker: Lookout Grush
Goblet.text: I'm watchin' ya. Spike promised that any meat that falls off is mine.
Goblet.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's standing a few paces away from the prisoner.NodeContext: Mean.

session_synopses.Rat_000: Rat in the torture cell who is starving because all the prisoners have been carted away.
session_synopses.Goblet: One of the guards standing next to the torture. He's mean (and a cannibal).

VoiceOfAbsolute.text: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experince a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experince a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.

VoiceOfAbsolute.text: Hear my voice. Obey my command.
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: CinematicNodeContext: Characters look on the verge of collapsing. NodeContext: Faint, yet authoritative. The voice of a omnipotent, yet unseen being.

VoiceOfAbsolute.speaker: Narrator
VoiceOfAbsolute.text: *The voice is irresistible. Every word is drenched with a power and authority that you do not understand, but cannot deny.*
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: InternalNodeContext: The player hasn't used their illithid powers

session_synopses.VoiceOfAbsolute: Before entering the goblin camp, a scene triggers in which the party hear the voice of the Absolute, and experience a vision of its Chosen Three (Ketheric, Gortash and Orin). The voice orders the player to help the three find the Orpheus artefact and to seek 'the path of illumination'.If a party member in the group has the Orpheus box in their inventory, they take it into their hands. It glows brighter and brighter, and then the voice and visions stop. The light from the box then fades, and the player(s) discuss the apparent protection the box provided from the Absolute’s influence.If no party member in the group has the Orpheus box in their inventory,and Shadowheart isn't alive to show up, the visions and voice will cause the party to pass out and experience a forced camp night where they receive the box.NOTE: this dialogue contains narrator nodes that're intended to be player-forward in the medium term until NPC assets are available for cinematics.

SpiderNest_CustomCrime.speaker: Narrator
SpiderNest_CustomCrime.text: *The goblins appear rather attached to their prisoners. Best not brutalise any more of them.*

TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.speaker: Narrator
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.text: *The goblin appears annoyed. It might be best to leave the prisoner alone.*
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.context: InternalNodeContext: Assault - gobs don't know about Den

session_synopses.SpiderNest_CustomCrime: Unvoiced crime dialogue, spoken by any goblin who witnesses a player attacking or killing a prisoner thrown into the spider pit at the goblin camp
session_synopses.TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom: Crime dialogue when a random goblin sees you hurting or killing Liam.

node_data.speaker: Devout Cry
node_data.text: Boss put ya to work, eh?

session_synopses: Goblin observer part of ritual. Wants you to be respectful of the king.

node_data.speaker: Rozzak
node_data.text: If you're here to help with the raid, talk to her ladyship. She's in charge.
node_data.context: NodeContext: deferential to 'her ladyship'. Dismissive toward us

session_synopses: Impatient goblin. Planning a raid with a drow, and he's deferring to her.

WarDrum.speaker: Narrator
WarDrum.text: *This mighty drum is powerful enough to be heard for miles. You need only strike it.*

WarDrum.speaker: Narrator
WarDrum.text: *Chaos ignites in the ruins around you. Goblins howl and spit, clawing for their weapons.*
WarDrum.context: InternalNodeContext: The player might play the drum again when the Backup and Checkpoint goblins are talking or dancing

session_synopses.WarDrum: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.

node_data.speaker: Tracker Azak
node_data.text: Leave me alone - ain't got time for chatter.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avoiding eye contact, afraidNodeContext: Avoiding eye contact, afraid - a slave speaking to a master

session_synopses: A goblin who is afraid of drow, having been a former slave

Goblin_001.speaker: Warrior Plagg
Goblin_001.text: Keep moving, 'less you're wanting a clubbing and drubbing.

Goblin_003.speaker: Tracker Nik-Nuk
Goblin_003.text: Heh. Boss Ragzlin weren't lying when he said anyone could join the Absolute's ranks.

session_synopses.Goblin_001: Goblin talking about that chump hero the Blade of Frontiers
session_synopses.Goblin_003: Drunken goblin isn't scared of that famous hero the Blade of Frontiers!

DuringPenance.speaker: Abdirak
DuringPenance.text: Come now, dear child. It is time to repent.
DuringPenance.context: NodeContext: Penance was interrupted. Player has returned to speak to Abdirak. Voice low and inviting as he wishes to continue the beating.

DuringPenance.speaker: Player
DuringPenance.text: What do you want me to do?
DuringPenance.context: InternalNodeContext: The penance didn't really start yet, the player wasn't hit yet.

DuringPenance.speaker: Abdirak
DuringPenance.text: Simply face that wall - and stay absolutely still.
DuringPenance.context: NodeContext: Authorative tone but also a warning. He wants to hurt the player but not badly, and not outside of his realm of control. Safety first!

Battlestation.speaker: Abdirak
Battlestation.text: My penitent child, the goblins have blood on their minds. I am leaving - I suggest you do the same.
Battlestation.context: NodeContext: The goblins are fighting, he's calm and measured but about to flee. He wants no part in it.

session_synopses.DuringPenance:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. 
Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening and creepy edge.
session_synopses.Battlestation: The goblins are fighting. He's going to leave, He loves pain - not death.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: That's lovely stuff, True Soul. Only... we smack that drum so the lads know there's killin' on.
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Goblin repsects player and is impressed by the song they played.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Not to worry! I'll set 'em straight. Bit of music never hurt anyone, eh?

Guard005.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Guard004.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Player is allowed inside; 'leave me alone' intention here.

Worg_001.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001.text: Wearin' me muck. Muck on ya. Good muck.
Worg_001.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and snuffling at the shit on your face. Spoken quickly, primal.

CliffWarning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

Guard003.speaker: Tracker Bal
Guard003.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Fallback node. RElatively friendly!

Backup003.speaker: Warlock Tud
Backup003.text: Lookin' at a future True Soul, you are. Boss Ragzlin says I'm next in line!

Backup003.speaker: Wyll
Backup003.text: Boss Ragzlin, eh? Must be the goblin in charge.
Backup003.context: NodeContext: Wyll overheard gpoblin mention Ragzlin, pronounced "RAGS-lin." That means his target is close.

Guard002.speaker: Warrior Puce
Guard002.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Neutral, not particularly friendly but not hostile

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: Greeting node inquiring - is the player part of her clan?

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: She gestures to himself and to you, as if to ask, 'go on, tell me, are you part of my clan?'

AlarmSystem.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem.text: *A great, taut drum sits before you. One strike would likely ring for miles, alerting goblin reinforcements.*

AlarmSystem.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem.text: *The echoes of the drumbeat fade to silence.*

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.context: InternalNodeContext: haven't met the guards yet, not drowNodeContext: Goblin's talking to his worg (big gross wolf). Evil character, not a nice person.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Unless you got another reason to be here, feck-shite.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player. Dripping with disdain.

Guard001.speaker: Gale
Guard001.text: Let's try to be diplomatic, shall we? Goblins don't come by the handfuls, but by the dozens.

Guard001.speaker: Narrator
Guard001.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Guard001.speaker: Player
Guard001.text: Beautiful animal. Does she belong to the Nordiland worgata family?

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.context: NodeContext: He's impressed. He's a worg expert so your knowledge appeals to him, but he doesn't want to make it too easy for you.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Dumb as a rock, but world class at tearin' the throats outta wee ones, she is.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Bit of affection, he's talking about his dog. Still with a hint of malice, though.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Rest of her litter's inside, in the pens. Beautiful beasts.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Bit of affection, he's talking about his dog. Still with a hint of malice, though.

Guard001.speaker: Player
Guard001.text: I've never seen a pack up close - always wanted to.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Be a shame if you came all this way without havin' a look. But I can't let you pass just like that.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Celebratin' a raid, we are. You'll need to wear our war colours.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Said greasily. He's playing a trick on the player.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Nice dab o' this across the mug oughta do it.
Guard001.context: CinematicNodeContext: *He pointed to a steaming pile of worg dung at his feet.*NodeContext: Pointing to worg shit as he says this. Stifling an evil laugh. He's told the player to smear shit in their face.

Guard001.speaker: Player
Guard001.text: Scoop up the warm dung and fling it at Olak's face.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.context: InternalNodeContext: Can flinging dung at Olek make him go blind for combat?NodeContext: Player threw dung in Olak's eyes. This leads to combat.

session_synopses.AlarmUsedReaction: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.
session_synopses.Guard005: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.
session_synopses.Guard004: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.
session_synopses.Worg_001: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.
session_synopses.CliffWarning: Goblin warns an intruder to leave
session_synopses.Guard003: A goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Squirrely, animalian type. Friendlier than most, but not extremely friendly.
session_synopses.TopCliffWarning: Player is climbing a cliff they shouldn't be and is spotted by a goblin guard.
session_synopses.Backup003: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. Very stoked about the Absolute.A little drunk. A hiccup or two wouldn't be out of place :)
session_synopses.Guard002: One of several goblin guards protecting a checkpoint. Grunt type who thinks he's more important than he is. If you humiliate yourself before him, he's gleeful in your misery.
session_synopses.Backup001: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. This goblin is a bit touched in the head and wonders whether you're a member of her tribe. She's a woman even though some of the notes are male.
session_synopses.AlarmSystem: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.
session_synopses.Guard001:
All guards at the checkpoint point the player to the guard with this dialog. He is an evil, nasty character who has no reason to go easy on the player. Should ooze disdain. This is the first goblin we meet and their weasly, cruel, wicked nature should stand out.
The goblin will let a non-allied player in only if they smear worg shit on their face. Yuck.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Oi! Ain't no party in 'ere - we're doing the Absolute's work.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, affronted - she's lost her patience with people stumbling in from the party.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: State yer business. Now.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Cold, deadly - the player has just passed through a party area, and this should be their first indication that the throne room is much more serious.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm here to see the True Souls. Do you want to keep them waiting?

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: ...Well, I didn't say that. But you'll need to be more specific, mate. Absolute's blessed us with three.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Realises she's treading on thin ice all of a sudden. Tone is more reasonable than other branches.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Your kind usually don't deal with Boss Ragzlin and Priestess Gut.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Guessin' you're after Minthara. Could be 'er blood by the looks of you.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm here for Ragzlin.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Well look, big-boots 'ere has an appointment with Dror Ragzlin hisself!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Mocking, making a big deal (Pronounced Drawer RAGS-lin)

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Throne room's at the back. He's communin', mind, so step soft.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dismissing you, warning you to be cautious.

session_synopses: This goblin guard is aggressive and self-important. She's been tasked with keeping drunkards out and is taking to her small responsibility like a little tyrant, but will immediately roll over if the player convinces her of their authority.

session_synopses.CINE_ClimbDown: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using a ladder to get from the Goblin Camp to the Underdark

node_data.speaker: Warrior Clack
node_data.text: If yer close enough to talk with me, then yer too damn close.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Busy sharpening spears, a bit brusque.

session_synopses: Impatient goblin sharpening his spears while guarding a heretical goblin. A bit of an attitude to this one.

node_data.speaker: Devout Muzul
node_data.text: 'Ere - you 'eard about wot happened on that last raid? Right so, some slob 'ad the drop on me...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Eager to tell this story to anyone who'll listen

node_data.speaker: Devout Muzul
node_data.text: Then she falls flat on 'er face with an arrow in 'er back! That's the Absolute that is. Protectin' me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proud

session_synopses: Goblin telling a war-story in which he conflates blind luck with "the will of God".

Goblin.speaker: Brawler Rancer
Goblin.text: Tha's the that of it. Heh!

session_synopses.Goblin: He's super drunk and is talking to himself more than to you.

Melee_01.speaker: Yerle
Melee_01.context: NodeContext: Flat, stony-faced. You keep trying to talk to her and she has no interest.

session_synopses.Melee_01: This guard is more aggressive than her counterpart. She's a thug/bouncer, and you're trying to stick your nose where you have no business.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Awshh... drink's goin' straight through me...
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk, to the point he's slightly unsteady on his feet

Goblin006.speaker: Player
Goblin006.text: The only cure is drinking more - as fast as you can.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Here's to them we nicked it off! Down one mug of ale for every throat we cut!
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: as if proposing a toast; he's drinking and celebrating

GoblinKid001.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001.context: NodeContext: "horns" line is a kid impressed by an adult who has ACTUAL HORNS - other line is dismissive and bratty

GoblinSleeper_01.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01.text: Try to keep it down, boss. My head's killing me.
GoblinSleeper_01.context: NodeContext: holding his head, wincing in pain from a hangover, trying to be respectful

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: You look like you got something jingling in your pocket.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanket

Trader.speaker: Player
Trader.text: Quite the trove. How'd you get your hands on all this?

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: Nicked 'em off the dead, didn't I?

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: Erh, I mean - raid spoils, your majesticality.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide-eyed, bowingNodeContext: Regretting his choice of words

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Ugh. You look like you've been kissin' a worg's backside.
GoblinKid000.context: CinematicNodeContext: waving his hand in front of his nose, exaggerating a bad smellNodeContext: disgusted and amused - reacting to player having dung smeared on their face. Worg is a wolf-like animal (

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Piss off, or you'll end up like this bleeder.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: cocky, aggressive - 'this bleeder' is a dead adventurer at his feet

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: A warning, whelp. Do not threaten me.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Whatcha gonna do about it? Run off and cry to yer spider-mum?
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: talking to a drow - 'spider-mum' refers to the drow goddess Lolth. This is a deeply dangerous and blasphemous thing to say, but he's too immature and cocky to realise he could be getting himself into serious trouble. Doesn't know boundaries.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: No. I'm going to cut out your tongue.

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Vaws-hak. My head hurts bad. You crash about like a drunken ogre.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: CinematicNodeContext: perhaps stmik walks into shot if the player is hitting the wall.NodeContext: (Vors-hack) means death - here delievered as an angry curse on waking. Not shouted. Seeting with anger, just woke and has a bad headache from drinking

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Didn't think drow were so clumsy. Leave us to rest.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: NodeContext: annoyed, but doesn't want to start a fight with a drow so trying to appease

Goblin000.speaker: Devout Mezzka
Goblin000.text: Wanna play, yer honour? Krolla will get you started.

Goblin001.speaker: Warrior Sul
Goblin001.text: This ale tastes like hobgoblin spit. Who's been pukin' in the barrel?

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Greetings, your most excellent drow-ness. What do you think of these breeches? Could be a new uniform.
DwarfOperator000.context: CinematicNodeContext: adjusting his new breeches, swaggeringNodeContext: He's adjusting his new breeches, impressed with his own fashion-sense

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator000.text: They look quite fetching on you.

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Proper stylish, ain't they? Nicked 'em off this dwarf we're cookin'.
DwarfOperator000.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself, talking about his new breeches

Goblin004.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
Goblin004.text: Quit pesterin' me - I'm tryin' to watch the game!
Goblin004.context: InternalNodeContext: Watching the chaseNodeContext: Friendly.

session_synopses.Goblin006: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.
session_synopses.GoblinKid001: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.
session_synopses.Ogre_00: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.
session_synopses.GoblinSleeper_01: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player
session_synopses.Trader: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.
session_synopses.GoblinKid000: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.
session_synopses.BugbearSleeper_00: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
session_synopses.Goblin000: A goblin drinking at the festivities following a successful raid. Discusses the chicken chase game the goblins ar eplaying nearby as well as the general festivities.Not drunk yet - fairly relaxed.
session_synopses.Goblin001: A goblin drinking merrily at a party - tipsy.
session_synopses.DwarfOperator000: This goblin is wearing a pair of fancy breeches he stole off a dead dwarf. A dead dwarf that he's currently helping to cook, on a spit. The breeches have a poem inside that contains a clue the players might need to open a dungeon inside the goblin camp, but Klagga is unaware of this. He'd rather admire his own fashion sense and flirt than figure out what the poem means, and he can be convinced to sell it or give it away.
session_synopses.Goblin004: A goblin enjoying the festivities following a successful raid. Fairly relaxed, not very drunk yet. Not particularly interested in conversation - occupied with the game of chicken chase happening nearby, drinking and trying to forget a painful wound.

node_data.speaker: Warlock Bolt
node_data.text: I'd do what he says. Ain't wanna make the boss any madder 'n he already is.

session_synopses: Standard goblin guard. Grouchy.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: Seen this mess? Flamin' Fist thuggo took a chunk outta me arm last raid out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's holding her arm up to playerNodeContext: Speaks to the player slightly more as an equal - they've been accepted into the camp thus far, after all. She's displaying a nasty wound

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You fought Flaming Fist?

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: That last inn we 'it. They were guardin' some uppity noble 'n his friends.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Almost bored at the story - she's describing an incident of great significance to you but she only cares about the fight and the spoils it brings

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: Not very well, mind. Drow carried him off, left the real spoils to us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Snorting, derisive. Both of the mercenaries who couldn't put up a fight, and of the fact that the drow only cared about taking hostages, leave the real valuables (in her eyes) behind

session_synopses: Non crit-path. This goblin is recounting stories of her last raid and displaying a wound. It's less a cause of pain than a subject for boasting.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: You see that eye wotsit floatin' about? Best hope it don't take a fancy to you...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nodding as if towards the 'wotsit'.NodeContext: Conspiratol tone. He doesn't like the 'device' and takes issue with it.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: ... unless you like playin' hide an' seek when yer tryin' to take a dump.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Crass. Obviously speaking from experience.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What is it?

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: It's a floatin' eye, mate. What do you reckon? Bloody spyin' on us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Player has asked what the device is doing here. Goblin reacts like it's a stupid question (it is).

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: The bigwigs at Moonrise like to 'be involved', the drow says.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'be involved' said in a mocking tone, clearly imitating the drow. And badly. Irritated and annoyed at the reasoning.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: Load o' trollop. Jus' don't trust us to do what we do best - killin' things.
node_data.context: NodeContext: In a huff. Annoyed and offended.

session_synopses: There's a floating eye moving throughout the camp. This goblin takes issue with it, he feels they are being spied on by their bosses, who don't trust them.

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: Well, lookie here. Seems like you know your way around the course.
Commentator.context: NodeContext: Reassessing you - you've just proven yourself to be quite good at the game and she's patronising you

Commentator.speaker: Player
Commentator.text: Your rules didn't say anything about fire.

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: Well who ever heard o' chicken chase without fire? We're not bloody amateurs.
Commentator.context: NodeContext: As if you're just being stupid now. Scornful - you can't play chicken chase without fire, keep up.

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: Oof. Hard luck, mate. Told you it weren't as easy as it looked.
Commentator.context: NodeContext: As if announcing a goal in a sporting event

Owlbear.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking aboutNodeContext: SFX only

Owlbear.speaker: Player
Owlbear.text: Kneel down - you won't hurt him.

Owlbear.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear.text: *You notice a shiver run through his feathered coat - fear, a desperate longing for the safety of his nest.*

Owlbear.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear.text: *But his mother is gone - taken. All that's left are these creatures.*

Owlbear.speaker: Player
Owlbear.text: Offer him your hand. He can follow your scent to your camp in the wilderness.

Owlbear.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cub tilts head, considering player, then backs away and leaves.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record.

session_synopses.Commentator: This goblin is a commentator on the much-loved goblin sport of chicken-chasing, which involves chasing a chicken (or later, a much larger owlbear) through a set of posts to score a 'chicken-strike'. She's fanatically devoted to the sport, and expects the same dedication from everyone. She'll invite the player to take part, but only if you make a bet.
session_synopses.Owlbear: This owlbear has been captured by the goblins. It is a cub and has been tormented by the goblins. In this dialog the player can reassure it, guide it to safety, or encourage it to attack the goblins. If the player has convinced his captors to release him, they can invite him to their camp. The owlbear refuses - but will show up later on his own.
session_synopses.GameOver: The Chase is over, the commentator tells the player to approach her.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: That the jingle of coin I hear? You've timed it well, my friend.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom CamNodeContext: Warm and welcoming (a kind of mercantile 'Who do we have here?')

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Already turned quite the profit today, so I'm feeling generous.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax you into a deal

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What business does someone like you have in a goblin camp?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: You joking? Goblins sell the best prisoners - cheap, quiet, and eager to be elsewhere.
node_data.context: NodeContext: You've made the assumption that there's nothing worth trading with goblins - she's the expert correcting you. As if giving tips to a novice

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Till this crowd converted and started sending their captives to Moonrise Towers, at least.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Correcting herself. Tone is rueful - some of her best trading partners have fallen to organised religion.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: No complaints, mind - I just sold enough smokepowder to cover the loss ten times over.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Perking up - she still managed to make a profit. Always a bright side.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What do you know about Moonrise Towers?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: All I need to - there's an awful lot of folk flowing that way, and coin is sure to follow.
node_data.context: NodeContext: She doesn't share your curiosity - but she sees the opportunity for business in Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Might have to find my faith and see this Absolute for myself, eh?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Speculative, joking - she'll happily pretend to be relgious if it means making a deal

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Still some deals to be done here, though - you want to trade, or what?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Eyeing you up, bringing you back to the topic at hand

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Now - much obliged for the chat, but I'm here to trade.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Insincere about the chat - she's just Impatient to get back to the matter at hand.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: A trader from the Zhentarim (z-HENT-ah-rim) , a shady organisation of spies, assassins and dealers in illicit goods. The player may or may not recognise her as such, but either way her attitude is blunt, breezy and unscrupulous. She's there to make money, and you're either there to make a deal or wasting her time - she has absolutely no interest in indecision or moralizing.

Parent.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent.context: NodeContext: Proud that the bear died

Kid_002.speaker: Three
Kid_002.text: It was so big but... it died so easy.
Kid_002.context: NodeContext: disappointed, doesn't really understand what's going on.

Beastmaster002.speaker: Beastmaster Zurk
Beastmaster002.text: Ever tried cuttin' up an elf? All skin an' bones, the rangy gits. My arm's gonna be sore tomorrow.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.text: Get rid of them. Release me.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speak with animals lineInternalNodeContext: Speak with animals lineNodeContext: Speak with animals line

Kid_001.speaker: One
Kid_001.text: D'you think it's bad to keep throwing stones at a dead lump?
Kid_001.context: NodeContext: curious, a bit naughty. She doesn't think it's bad at all.

AfterRelease_Bear.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionNodeContext: Speak with Animals line

AfterRelease_Bear.speaker: Halsin
AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionInternalNodeContext: Bear allied with player against goblins.

Worg_001.speaker: Ferr
Worg_001.text: Smells big. Big belly. Big GUTS.

Worg_002.speaker: Tale
Worg_002.text: Fur. Can't you smell the fur? Fur and meat. Lots of MEAT!

session_synopses.Parent: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Kid_002: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Beastmaster002: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage: A  bear who is imprisoned in the goblin camp. This bear is in fact the arch druid Halsin, though he doesn't reveal this to us until after he's out of his cage, even if we use Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Kid_001: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or Halsin's bear
session_synopses.AfterRelease_Bear: After the goblins release the bear its asks you if you will help him to kill them.
session_synopses.Worg_001: One of the worgs in the worg pens, driven mad with excitement by the presence of Halsin, a druid transofrmed into a bear.
session_synopses.Worg_002: One of the worgs in the worg pens, driven mad with excitement by the presence of Halsin, a druid transformed into a bear.

Branding.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding.text: Ready to figure out what's goin' on with those shadows in your head?

session_synopses.Branding:
The sadistic goblin priestess is branding new converts to the cult of the Absolute. She is a True Soul - tadpoled, but unaware that is the case. She believes she is communing directly with the Absolute.

 She's one of three leaders in the goblin camp, and an important and powerful member of the Absolute's cult. She's cruel and has a sense of superiority over her own kind. Her offers of help are really a ploy to separate players from their friends so that she can imprison them and watch as the parasite eats them alive.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Nrog
node_data.text: Priestess burned ya, then? Thought I smelled somethin' tasty cookin'.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sniffs player before delivering line.NodeContext: Sniffs at player again before delivering line. Tone is mocking but friendly.

session_synopses: This goblin is standing guard inside temple - he's a little more relaxed than his zealous companion. Offers 'beginners' advice to player. As hostile as any other goblin if you try to pass without his superior's permission.

SpottedHostilePlayer.text: You! I remember you from the forest. You should never have come here.
SpottedHostilePlayer.context: NodeContext: They are hostile toward you and will fight you after htis line.

session_synopses.SpottedHostilePlayer: Priests of Conquering God can become hostile in FOR. If player leaves combat, priests still apear at Goblin Camp. This dialog happens if they spot a hostile player just to show player the reason why the whole camp suddenly becomes hostile.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Huh? What do you want? I'm tryin' to concentrate on readin'!
node_data.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Can I see the manuscript?

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: I ain't finished with it! There's enough readin' here to last me a lifetime.
node_data.context: NodeContext: indignant

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It'll be a very short lifetime if you don't hand me the manuscript.
True

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Bloody hell - an' people say goblins are savage.
node_data.context: NodeContext: upset, afraid - we're bullying him

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: It ain't worth fightin' over. Take it!
node_data.context: NodeContext: upset afraid, we're bullying him

session_synopses: He is smarter than your average goblin, and is reading a manuscript - loose papers, freshly written by Volo. It's a study of goblin behaviour that would give anyone who reads it an advantage in combat against goblins.

EyeMurder_AD.speaker: Dror Ragzlin, Erna, GROUP_Goblins, Nightwarden Minthara, Yerle
EyeMurder_AD.text: 'S dead. Spied one too many bowels movin', I expect.
EyeMurder_AD.context: NodeContext: Satisfied contempt - the goblins hated this creepy thing and are glad it's dead

session_synopses.EyeMurder_AD: A one-time line triggered when a goblin guard spots the dead scrying eye.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: There! That's the last frothing innard catalogued.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: investigating dead goblins - pleased to meet the perpetraror of the masscare

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Best not to hang around. Whoever is responsible for this mess may still be here... unless this was your doing?
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: polite advice on first sentence, and then a warning. The final phrase is a mixture of curiosity and awe

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: You? Why? And how? But wait, wait - let me get a fresh quill. Now. You were saying?
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: preparing to take notes like an inquisitive journalist at a crime scene

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre.text: Never mind. What are you doing here anyway - looting corpses?

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Just nosing out the facts. Something happened here, and it's my job - my calling - to discover what.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: arrogant - his 'calling' (at this moment, asking annoying questions) is the most important thing in the world as far as he sees it

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: But if you won't tell me, no matter. A truth is second best to the truth.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: journalistic type who is more interested in a good story than a true story

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Hmmm... Your story may be relevant, but the stench of this place is hardly suited to civilised conversation.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: politely trying to tag along with the players

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: I wonder if we might continue this elsewhere. You've a brain I'd like to pick.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre.text: Find me at my camp - we can talk there.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Smashing! Ta for now, my friend - only for now!
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: delighted to be invited to join the players' camp

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Don't go botherin' my pigeon! He's mine.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: annoyed, defensive - the 'pigeon' is in fact Volo, a human captive she's been forcing to sing; he's now locked behind a prison door

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage.text: So I see. Do you have plans for this 'pigeon'?

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Keep him safe. Listen to him coo. 'Til I gets hungry or some such.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: explaining as if to an idiot

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: You there! A friendly face. You haven't the looks of one of these cultists about you, no sir!

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: I'm in no hurry to take my turn on that spit out front. Perhaps you'd be so kind as to unlock this cage?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage.text: How did you end up in this place?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Curiosity, my friend. It didn't benefit the cat, but it's the foundation of my career.

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Though I admit I've hit something of an impasse. Please - unlock my cell?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage.text: All right - I'll get you out.

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Bless you, my friend! I'll wait nicely, but please don't tarry!

session_synopses.Volo_Massacre: Volo, a reknowned scholar, has been captured by goblins and is being forced to sing on a stage at their celebratory party following a raid. One goblin has the responsibility of guarding him and engages him in conversation. If the goblins are killed, he investigates the corpses, researching the cause of death.
session_synopses.Guard_AtCage: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.
